programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce chairs the topical debate from Bristol. With minister in the defence department Dr Andrew Murrison MP, Shadow Attorney General Emily Thornberry MP, Liberal Democrats' spokesperson on Housing and Communities Helen Morgan MP, Chief Executive of Oxfam GB Danny Sriskandarajah and editor of the Spectator magazine Fraser Nelson

programme.title: Newscast
programme.desc: BBC journalists including Adam Fleming and Chris Mason host a weekly round-up from Westminster, delivering the usual mix of serious analysis and light-hearted gossip about the biggest stories in politics

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Comedians Stephen Bailey and Asim Chaudhry, reality star Gemma Collins and actress Sally Lindsay join host Rob Brydon and regular captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the offbeat panel show. As usual, the participants set out to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible fibs about themselves in a bid to secure a team victory, through rounds such as Home Truths and Quick-fire Lies

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Adil Ray hosts an extended episode of the satirical current affairs quiz, with presenter James May and MP Jess Phillips joining team captains Paul Merton and Ian Hislop to examine the events of May 2022

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Charlie Stayt and Naga Munchetty present a round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Gethin Jones co-hosts the weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: The Moment of Proof
programme.desc: Fingerprints found at the scene of a burglary are the missing piece of evidence detectives need to convict a man responsible for the murder of the flat owner. When a man is found beaten to death in his own property, police use footprints found around his body to identify one assailant, before putting together their case against his violent accomplice whom they suspect of the killing. Plus, a pair of crooks who burgled an old man and went on a spending spree with his card are caught by CCTV

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: The keepers face a tough decision regarding beloved wolf Dave, who after 13 years as the park's unabashed troublemaker, is now laid low with a mystery illness. Meanwhile, four new feisty wallabies arrive, needing to be microchiped and wormed before being introduced to the paddock. Presented by Ben Fogle and Kate Humble

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts, Dion Dublin and Martel Maxwell explore a former stables and church in Dover with potential for renovation, and terraced properties in Barnsley and Cockermouth

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Natasha Raskin Sharp visits Worcester, where experts Thomas Forrester and Tim Weeks guide two teams in their search for valuable items before heading to the auction in Staffordshire. Natasha also visits a rare collection of Traveller caravans

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Hope Street
programme.desc: When an ATM machine is stolen, new detective Al crosses a line to save someone he loves. Meanwhile, Finn struggles to cope - and has a difficult conversation with Siobhan. Drama set in the fictional town of Port Devine on the Northern Ireland coast, starring Amara Karan, Niall Wright and Kerri Quinn

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Tim Weeks tackles a Peter Pan gramophone that has seen better days. Upholsterer Sonnaz Nooranvary and carpenter William Kirk mend a child's rocking chair. Presented by Jay Blades

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Ginny Buckley helps a couple and their dogs to make a fresh start in the Cornish countryside. For their £550,000 budget they want a character property with plenty of room inside for their family to stay, plus space outside for their beloved dogs. Ginny's time in Cornwall coincides with the preparations for an annual steam fair extravaganza, where she gets behind the wheel of a magnificent vintage engine

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Charles Hanson and Raj Bisram embark on the final leg of their trip in north Wales. Raj stops off in Colwyn Bay to learn about a missionary with a tragic yet inspiring story, while Charles visits the former site of the Coastal Artillery School in Llandudno. Anticipating a dynamite final auction, both experts endeavour to procure some potential big-hitters to go under the gavel

programme.title: Bridge of Lies
programme.desc: Colleagues Tarlochan, Barry, Robert and Craig compete for cash by crossing a bridge of stepping stones across the studio floor. Quiz show, hosted by Ross Kemp

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with Richard Osman

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Ronan Keating chat to studio guests, while a team of roving reporters present topical stories from around the UK

programme.title: Question of Sport
programme.desc: Former world champion boxer Anthony Crolla, sport broadcaster Eilidh Barbour, Commonwealth gold medal winning netballer Eboni Usoro-Brown and Scottish rugby star Adam Hastings join team captains Ugo Monye and Sam Quek and host Paddy McGuinness on the quiz

programme.title: Beyond Paradise
programme.desc: Panic spreads throughout Shipton Abbott when an arsonist targets three local businesses, scrawling the word PIG at the scene of each fire. Humphrey and the team are baffled until they realise the fires follow an unusual pattern by invoking the Three Little Pigs fable. A reluctant Kelby is called on by an eccentric local to investigate a break-in, but soon realises that this might be the key to solving the arson case. Elsewhere, Martha has some serious thinking to do. Detective drama, starring Kris Marshall, Sally Bretton and Dylan Llewellyn

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Comedian and writer Tom Allen, former Blue Peter presenter Sarah Greene, rugby star Ugo Monye and comedian Morgana Robinson join host Rob Brydon and regular captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the offbeat panel show. As usual, the participants set out to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible fibs about themselves in a bid to secure a team victory, through rounds such as Home Truths and Quick-fire Lies

programme.title: The Cleaner
programme.desc: Crime scene cleanser is called to a theatre, where a male strip show has got out of hand, resulting in a 40-woman brawl. However, a blood-splattered auditorium is the least of his problems when a self-important clown, a whimsical theatre manager, a feckless assistant and a broken fire alarm all combine to create a nightmare day at work. Dark comedy, starring Greg Davies, with Simon Callow

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Pretty Woman (1990)
programme.desc: A ruthless millionaire hires a prostitute while on a business trip. Realising she may be useful in helping him keep up a successful appearance, he pays her to accompany him for a week as he associates with the rich and powerful - but falls in love despite their many differences. Romantic comedy, starring Richard Gere and Julia Roberts, with Ralph Bellamy and Laura San Giacomo

programme.title: Michael McIntyre's The Wheel
programme.desc: The comedian is back with his colossal spinning wheel, offering three contestants the chance to secure the final cash prize - but only one of them can play for the jackpot. Helping them along the way are celebrity experts Chris Hoy, Georgia Toffolo, Robert Peston, Snoochie Shy, Bez, Dr Zoe Williams and Joel Dommett

programme.title: Celebrity Mastermind
programme.desc: EastEnders actor Ricky Groves, comedian Harriet Kemsley, Made in Chelsea star Verity Bowditch and writer Bonnie Greer are in the famous black chair, answering Clive Myrie's questions on James Bond Themes, Sloths, naturalist Sir David Attenborough and American actress and singer Hattie McDaniel

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Live
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt is joined by chefs Jack Croft, Will Murray and Saliha Mahmood Ahmed, plus special guest Greg James. Helen McGinn picks the wines to go with the studio dishes

programme.title: Nadiya's Everyday Baking
programme.desc: Nadiya Hussain creates some family bakes, from daughter Maryam's ultimate jam and chocolate flapjacks, to an easy oven-baked chilli topped with crunchy tortillas, and an epic cookie pie. Nadiya also continues to showcase inspiring bakers from across the UK, this time focusing on Louise Nicholson, whose colourful vegan bakes such as her signature highland cow and unicorn cupcake have taken Edinburgh by storm

programme.title: Football Focus
programme.desc: Alex Scott and guests look ahead to the weekend's fixtures, including Arsenal v Leeds United, plus news from the lunchtime game between Manchester City and Liverpool

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Anita Manning and Christina Trevanion present from the Oswestry Showground, where the teams search for antiques with the help of Kate Bliss and Ochuko Ojiri

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Charlie Dimmock and the Rich brothers meet a couple in Clapham juggling older parents, twin babies and busy careers, while in Shrewsbury, a garden has nothing exciting for children

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Briony May Williams is on her home turf in Somerset as she helps a couple swap their narrow boat for a more traditional house. She also visits a market garden initiative which operates alongside a hostel for the homeless

programme.title: Final Score
programme.desc: A round-up of the results and this afternoon's news from the Premier League, EFL and Scotland

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Celebrity Mastermind
programme.desc: Journalist John Pienaar, lead singer of Britpop band Shed Seven, Rick Witter, comedian Suzi Ruffell, and actor Dakota Blue Richards are in the famous black chair, answering Clive Myrie's questions on Clement Attlee, the Smiths, the films of Sandra Bullock, and the music of Lana Del Rey

programme.title: Celebrity Bridge of Lies
programme.desc: Ross Kemp hosts the game show, which sees radio presenters Tony Blackburn, Katie Thistleton, YolanDa Brown and Lauren Layfield taking it in turns to cross the floor by only stepping on the correct answers - and doing their best to avoid the wrong ones. For the final crossing, those who have been successful join forces for a chance to take home the money for their chosen charities

programme.title: Blankety Blank
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh hosts a revival of the comedy quiz show, in which a panel of six celebrities fill in the missing blanks to help contestants win some brilliant prizes. With Adjoa Andoh, Martine McCutcheon, Johnny Vegas, Jimmy Carr, Chizzy Akudolu and Joe Swash

programme.title: Pointless Celebrities
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman present a star-studded version of the general knowledge quiz. Tomasz Schafernaker, Owain Wyn Evans, Kerry Godliman, Toussaint Douglass, Nicki Chapman, Kelli Young, Jeremy Edwards and Lucy Dixon try to come up with the least likely correct answers to a series of questions posed to members of the public to win a prize for the charity of their choice

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Faith treats a patient who has been pulled from the water after a car crash, but her sense of control is tested when an unexpected arrival forces her to confront her darkest secret. She recalls a time when frustration with her own children drove her to lose control, and seeks to make amends by coming to the aid of her patient's distraught daughter

programme.title: Magpie Murders
programme.desc: Anthony Horowitz's adaptation of his novel, starring Lesley Manville. Editor Susan Ryeland is eagerly awaiting the manuscript from Clover Books' number one best-selling author Alan Conway, whose hero Atticus Pünd regularly solves murder mysteries in the fictional village of Saxby on Avon. Susan is drawn into her own mystery when she and her boss realise that the final chapter is missing and Conway is found dead in his shrubbery. With Conleth Hill and Tim McMullan

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Gary Lineker presents highlights of the latest Premier League fixtures, including Manchester City v Liverpool at Etihad Stadium and Arsenal v Leeds United at Emirates Stadium. The Citizens were looking to avenge a 1-0 defeat at Anfield against an inconsistent Liverpool side, while fellow title-challengers Arsenal will have expected three points against struggling Leeds. Plus, Bournemouth v Fulham, Brighton & Hove Albion v Brentford, Crystal Palace v Leicester City, Nottingham Forest v Wolverhampton Wanderers and Chelsea v Aston Villa

programme.title: Legends of Welsh Sport
programme.desc: A celebration of one of football's most talented players, from his early days as a promising young prospect to his rise to fame with Tottenham and his record-breaking transfer to Real Madrid. This documentary offers and inside look into his life and career

programme.title: Match of the Day Top 10
programme.desc: Gary Lineker, Alan Shearer and Micah Richards count down the best pundits of the Premier League era

programme.title: Anton & Giovanni's Adventures in Sicily
programme.desc: The second leg of their trip takes Anton and Giovanni to Mount Etna, Europe's highest and most active volcano. Along the way Giovanni takes Anton to a traditional Sicilian barber to get beach ready before trying paddleboarding in the Ionian Sea. When they reach the volcano, the pair hike halfway to the summit with some help from some unexpected furry friends before deciding to camp overnight. A surprise visit from 2021 Strictly champion Rose Ayling-Ellis wakes them up and they complete their trek in style by taking to the skies and flying over the crater in a helicopter

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Sonali Shah helps a couple from the largest town in Dorset to move to rural Devon, and learns the importance of local newspapers in keeping communities connected and informed

programme.title: The Moment of Proof
programme.desc: Police find the names of an international drug network in a hotel guest book plus thieves who stole £20,000 worth of food are caught out by a car number plate

programme.title: Paul Whitehouse: Our Troubled Rivers
programme.desc: Part one of two. The actor, writer and comedian travels around England and Wales looking at the issues that their rivers and waterways are facing. He begins by visiting the north of England to find out the impact water companies have on rivers, exploring the change in the industry since privatisation in 1989 and what regulations are in place when it comes to sewage discharge. He meets concerned locals looking to highlight the health of the River Wharfe, a conservationist who warns of the ecological decline in iconic Lake Windemere, and singer Feargal Sharkey, who has become a figurehead for the campaign to prevent water companies dumping sewage into UK waterways and seas

programme.title: BBC News at 9
programme.desc: The latest headlines, breaking news and sport from the BBC newsroom.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break

programme.title: Politics Live
programme.desc: The latest stories from Westminster and beyond

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Rick Edwards hosts the quiz in which contestants compete for the chance to win £10,000, with a single 'impossible' answer knocking them out for the day

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers' Pubs That Built Britain
programme.desc: Si and Dave take a Manchester pub crawl to uncover historic establishments once at the heart of the city's industrial revolution. Starting in Middleton, they discover that politics, protest and plotting were rife in a pub's back rooms in the early 1800s, before visiting a local brewery to find out more about the popularity of beer in Britain

programme.title: Celebrity Painting Challenge
programme.desc: Mariella Frostrup presents the final, which sees the best three contestants putting everything they have learned into practice. First they must capture the sensuality and movement of the Argentine tango on canvas, as performed by former Strictly Come Dancing professionals Flavia Cacace and Vincent Simone. Then they paint through the night at the Natural History Museum - and for the first time they can choose the subject matter from the museum's millions of items. There follows a charity auction where all six contestants put their favourite artworks up for sale, before the winner's name is announced

programme.title: My Unique B&B
programme.desc: Master craftsman Simon Parfett and his team are in Warwickshire to turn a 200-year-old turret into a medieval-themed B&B. The tiny two-floored building may look like a turret on the outside, but on the inside it's a bland office and storage space that couldn't be less regal

programme.title: Grizzly Bear Cubs and Me
programme.desc: Part one of two. Gordon Buchanan joins the Pazhetnovs, a pioneering family of biologists in Russia as they attempt to rehab grizzly bear cub orphans. There are more than 100,000 grizzlies in Russia and as humans encroach further into this vast wilderness, conflict is increasing. The Pazhetnovs have been rescuing orphaned cubs for nearly three decades and have successfully returned more than 200 of them back to the wild. Gordon arrives in February when six cubs have just been rescued. They are just five weeks old and each weigh less than a bag of sugar

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Five experts assess items brought to the Blickling estate in Norfolk, with David Harper excited by an early device for watching films, while David Fletcher and James Lewis reminisce about Rupert the Bear books and Dinky toys. Paul Martin enjoys a ride in a tank on historic former military camp

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Lucy Beaumont, Shazia Mirza, Joe Thomas and Jake Wood test their general knowledge skills in the hope of winning a prize

programme.title: Coast to Coast Food Festival
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher explores the annual Neath Food and Drink Festival and finds out whether traditional or gourmet Welsh cakes are more popular among the visitors. Food journalist Leyla Kazim reveals the secrets of growing tomatoes on a large or small scale farmer Jim Smith gets stuck into making marmalade and Ryan Hand tries an experiment to find out whether there is such a thing as brain food

programme.title: Your Home Made Perfect
programme.desc: Hemal and Kapila have wrestled with how to improve their four-bedroom family home and make the space work better for them and their three children, but their ideas for a project have not moved forward. Now, architects Will Foster and Lizzie Fraher compete using virtual reality to win the opportunity to remodel the property. Presented by Angela Scanlon

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The eight regional champions cook their desserts in a bid to secure the last place on the menu at the banquet. Morwenna Banks, voice of Mummy Pig on Peppa Pig, is the guest judge

programme.title: Get on Up: The Triumph of Black America
programme.desc: Actor David Harewood travels across the US to discover the stories behind his artistic heroes from the 1960s to the 1990s. Along the way he discovers how these African-American performers, film-makers and writers have come to transform popular culture around the world

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Dara O Briain and Hugh Dennis look back at some of the news of the week, with guests James Acaster, Angela Barnes, Ed Byrne and Nish Kumar

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: The day's important national and international news stories. With Victoria Derbyshire

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Murder in Mayfair
programme.desc: Reporter Nawal Al-Maghafi investigates the murder of Norwegian student Martine Vik Magnussen in 2008, who was killed in a flat near Mayfair after a night out. Al-Maghafi seeks answers from the only suspect, Farouk Abdulhak, the son of a Yemeni billionaire who, hours after Magnussen's death fled the UK to Yemen, and uncovering how money, political power and Yemeni law protected Farouk once he absconded to Yemen, which has no extradition treaty with the UK

programme.title: Saving Lives in Leeds
programme.desc: Cardiac surgeon Betsy Evans operates on her longest-waiting patient, Andy, who has a hereditary heart condition and needs an urgent triple bypass. A lack of intensive care beds for after-surgery means he has been waiting on the ward for four weeks and, as he also has bipolar disorder, every day spent waiting has been a challenge for his mental health. Professor Simon Kay aims to perform hand surgery on a teenage patient whose fingers are bent inwards, having been born with a rare and incurable joint condition called arthrogryposis

programme.title: Scarlett's Driving School
programme.desc: Single mother Amy is desperate to learn to drive to improve the lives of her kids. But after 13 years learning and two failed tests under the instruction of her own mother, both feel they are going backwards. During five days, they must try and stop Amy's panic attacks while driving

programme.title: Inside Our Autistic Minds
programme.desc: The second of two documentaries in which Chris Packham helps people on the autism spectrum create short films that reveal what is really going on inside their minds. He meets Anton, a teaching assistant and trance DJ with a deep love of Middlesbrough FC, and Ethan, a 19-year-old student and aspiring rapper from Essex. He helps them make films to reveal to their friends and classmates how they feel about change and hypersensitivity to noise respectively

programme.title: Saved and Remade
programme.desc: A vintage sewing table with great sentimental value, an old family tent and a martial arts expert's karate belts are among the transformations by the team of skilled craftspeople. Sabrina Grant hosts

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Nicki Chapman helps a buyer with a budget of £450,000 escape her ex-council flat in south London so her and her daughter can start a new life in the Wiltshire countryside

programme.title: The Moment of Proof
programme.desc: A fingerprint on a fish and chips wrapper places a gunman in a rural location and police on a stakeout witness the shooting of their target. Plus, a fraudster uses victim's credit details to buy gift cards at luxury shops until police track him down and find a plethora of evidence on his laptop

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don grows a plant he's never tried before - loofahs. Joe Swift visits a garden where the contemporary and traditional meet. And Advolly Richmond discovers a stunning Japanese-inspired garden

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break

programme.title: Politics UK
programme.desc: The week's political proceedings around the UK

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Rick Edwards hosts the quiz in which contestants compete for the chance to win £10,000, with a single 'impossible' answer knocking them out for the day

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers' Pubs That Built Britain
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers are in Cornwall, discovering pubs that were at the centre of the smuggling industry back in the late 1700s. They start out in the tiny fishing village of Polperro, discovering a smugglers' tunnel and a landlord with criminal connections. Heading inland to Bodmin Moor they visit the famous Jamaica Inn, where they find out how to make the famous tipple of the time - rum shrub

programme.title: The Big Painting Challenge
programme.desc: Mariella Frostrup and Richard Coles host the nationwide search for Britain's best amateur artist as 10 contestants put their still life skills to the test, with some words of advice from Diana Ali and Pascal Anson. The artists must first paint a table laden with objects, before being split into two groups and challenged to produce a homage to either Van Gogh or Lichtenstein. Judges Lachlan Goudie, Daphne Todd and David Dibosa assess their efforts and decide who should be eliminated from the contest

programme.title: My Unique B&B
programme.desc: Master craftsman Simon Parfett and his team visit a lighthouse on the Bristol channel, which has been run as a B&B business for many years by owners Danielle and Frank. However, they have now decided they want their home back, but don't want to give up the hospitality business completely

programme.title: Grizzly Bear Cubs and Me
programme.desc: Part two of two. With only 10 weeks before they are due to be released, Gordon Buchanan begins training the cubs for their new life in the Russian wilderness. They learn survival skills and spend time exploring a special wilderness training zone just outside the enclosure where they can experience the wild. However, little cub Pasha is still struggling, and the team worry he may not make it

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Antique experts Catherine Southon and Jonathan Pratt search for items in Kent to take off to auction. Catherine falls for a colourful brooch and Jonathan unearths a horn beaker used by Winston Churchill. Host Paul Martin uncovers the story of Dover Castle's secret tunnels.

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Lucy Beaumont, Shazia Mirza, Joe Thomas and Jake Wood hope they have what it takes to walk off with the winning trophy before Richard Osman announces the victor

programme.title: Coast to Coast Food Festival
programme.desc: Colin Murray discovers a brown sauce revival and the advantages of getting fish from a fishmonger as he visits Londonderry's Walled City Market. Briony-May Williams explores how Somerset is rivalling France in cheese productions, and Onkar Singh Purewal discovers the secrets of beekeeping

programme.title: Your Garden Made Perfect
programme.desc: Pam and Marcus have a big garden surrounded by large established trees, which stretches away from their suburban home in St Albans, Hertfordshire. Now their children have grown up, they want to transform the garden into a space they they can enjoy themselves. Designer Helen Elks-Smith is set on a design that begins with the home, while rival Tom Massey wants to transport them to another world. Which idea will the couple choose? Presented by Angela Scanlon

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Adam Frost gets to work on his veg plot and plants his first lot of potatoes. Joe Swift meets a garden designer who faced the challenge of two awkward, adjoining plots and transformed them into wonderful, cohesive spaces. Plus, Rekha Mistry demonstrates how to grow the perfect onion from seed, and has a go at growing cotton

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Brighton Royal Pavilion is the setting for the final banquet, where the overall winner will be decided. Judges Tom Kerridge, Nisha Katona and Ed Gamble have chosen four contestants whose menus have celebrated the theme of animation and illustration in honour of Paddington's 65th Birthday. There will also be the highest runner-up on hand to help with the mini courses, but who will really impress the guests, which include Cressida Cowell and Lenny Henry?

programme.title: Cunk on Britain
programme.desc: Philomena Cunk continues her historical odyssey, exploring the stories of the Tudors, the Georgians, the English Civil War, William Shakespeare, Witchfinder General Matthew Hopkins and Lord Horatio Nelson. She also looks into Henry VIII's chronic addiction to wives. With historian Kate Williams

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: MOTDx
programme.desc: Jermaine Jenas and the team reveal more of the lifestyle and culture that surrounds the Premier League and those involved in it

programme.title: Get on Up: The Triumph of Black America
programme.desc: Actor David Harewood travels across the US to meet his heroes, and discovers some of the true stories behind the artists who inspired him. Along the way he discovers how these African American performers, filmmakers and writers have come to transform popular culture around the world

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: Millions of council houses were built after the war to help protect people from slum landlords. They used to be home to around a third of the UK population. Margaret Thatcher's flagship right-to-buy policy boosted home ownership, but the council house sell-off is causing major problems 40 years on. Reporter Richard Bilton investigates what's been happening by telling the story of one housing estate in London

programme.title: Parole
programme.desc: Forty-five-year-old Jon has been locked up for 19 years after violently robbing three students in 2004. A veteran of six previous parole hearings, he hopes an intense period of therapy has changed him enough for the board to give him a chance this time? Bethany, 23, breached her Criminal Behaviour Order in 2020 after repeatedly threatening to throw herself off motorway bridges, risking her own life and members of the public. Can she convince the board that she isn't a threat to herself or the public anymore?

programme.title: Bill Bailey: Larks in Transit
programme.desc: A stand-up performance by the 2020 Strictly champion in which he became the first British comedian to tread the boards of the Royal Opera House in Covent Garden, sharing tales from more than 20 years as a travelling performer. Topics include Google reviews of Poundland stores, a unique proposal for a Victorian-style Love Island and Old MacDonald sung in the style of Tom Waits. With a guest appearance by soprano Florence Hvorostovsky

programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.desc: Tag is grumpy as he did not eat his breakfast

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: The squirrels learn that friends can be like family

programme.desc: Evil Pea wears a giant power suit

programme.title: Shaun the Sheep
programme.desc: When one of the pigs attempts to make friends with Timmy, his cohorts evict him as punishment for un-pig-like behaviour

programme.title: Dennis & Gnasher Unleashed!
programme.desc: In the run-up to the school play, spooky goings-on make the gang wonder if the mythical Bash Street Bogeyman might be real and still stalking the corridors

programme.title: Boy Girl Dog Cat Mouse Cheese
programme.desc: A reluctant Cat lands a role in a movie that is shooting in town

programme.title: The Football Academy
programme.desc: U-12 players Heinzy and Marley are excited about a match against Germany, while Orion of the U-16s gets the opportunity to shine in front of millions of viewers

programme.title: The Dengineers
programme.desc: Sea cadet Jonny wants a submarine-themed den where he can celebrate his passion for naval history

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: The doctors reveal how the human brain creates maps to prevent people from getting lost

programme.title: Newsround
programme.desc: Current affairs reports aimed at a younger audience

programme.title: Blue Peter
programme.desc: The team joins up with Radio 2 for a gardening campaign

programme.title: Deadly Pole to Pole
programme.desc: Steve Backshall presents a profile of his favourite animal - the wolf. The presenter looks back at some of his past encounters with the creatures, including his search for grey wolves in Yellowstone National Park, and his quests to see the rare Ethiopian wolf and the critically endangered red wolf. He also explores man's complicated history with the animals, and travels to a wolf conservation centre, where he demonstrates how their senses make them formidable hunters

programme.title: Life in the Air
programme.desc: The final episode of the series features footage shot from within a giant flock of birds, revealing how half a million of them can fly in a group without colliding with each other. The programme also showcases the world's fastest airborne courtship display, a bird that savagely defends its territory, and conflict between moths and bats in the South American jungle

programme.title: Supergiant Animals
programme.desc: Steve Backshall travels across the world to encounter the largest animals he can find and discover the remarkable things their size enables them to do. Highlights include Steve swimming with Nile crocodiles in Botswana, dodging two-ton elephant seals in California and diving with sperm whales in the Caribbean

programme.title: Coast to Coast Food Festival
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher and Edith Bowman visit the National Ploughing Championships in Derbyshire on a food adventure, where they discover the story behind the Bakewell tart and are let loose on tractors. Farmer Meinir Howells reveals the secrets of one of the UK's oldest ice-cream parlours, Ryan Hand finds out the superpowers of seeds, and farmer Jim Smith learns the art of pickling

programme.title: Celebrity Best Home Cook
programme.desc: The competition reaches the halfway point, where the contestants are challenged by Mary Berry to prepare the ultimate Sunday roast. The only rule is that the meal must involve roasted meat and some form of potatoes - they are otherwise free to do whatever they want. Two cooks compete to produce the best pork crackling, while another adds a Morrocan twist. For the second task, Chris Bavin challenges the cooks to make banana bread without using flour, while the final round involves a classic French dessert

programme.title: Dark Victory (1939)
programme.desc: An extravagant socialite's discovery that she has a brain tumour prompts her to resolve to live her remaining time to the full. Drama, with Bette Davis, Humphrey Bogart, George Brent and Ronald Reagan

programme.title: Interior Design Masters
programme.desc: The designers work in pairs to transform three independent shops in Harrogate, North Yorkshire, on a budget of £3,000 in just two days. Ry and Jack struggle to relate to the clientele of the shoe shop they're designing and Alan wonders if Ry has lost his mojo. Tom and Temi are paired together to transform the Sheepskin shop, but a disagreement over colour schemes could derail their design before it has even been made. Monika and Peter get to work on a minimalist but functional scheme for a fashion store but Monika worries she has bitten off more than she can chew

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Paul Martin and the team value antiques at Blackpool Tower Circus, where expert James Lewis discovers terracotta tomb figures that could be more than 1,000 years old. Plus, Anita Manning examines a collection of seaside postcards, and Paul explores the Morecambe Winter Gardens - one of Lancashire's most famous theatres

programme.title: Live Women's Six Nations
programme.desc: Scotland v Wales (Kick-off 5.30pm). All the action from both teams' second match of the championship, held at DAM Health Stadium. Wales claimed a narrow 24-19 victory when the teams met in Cardiff last year, with substitute Ffion Lewis' late try proving to be the difference, and the victors went on to finish fifth in the table, while the Scots failed to win a match

programme.title: Frank Sinatra: A Man and His Music
programme.desc: A TV special from 1967 in which the singer and actor is joined by jazz singer Ella Fitzgerald and bossa nova guitarist Antonio Carlos Jobim. Songs performed include Ole Man River, Body and Soul, The Lady Is a Tramp, The Girl from Ipanema and What Now My Love

programme.title: Frank Sinatra: At the Royal Festival Hall
programme.desc: A 1970 concert at the London venue by the singer and actor, with Princess Grace of Monaco introducing him on stage. Featuring performances of I've Got You Under My Skin, The Lady Is a Tramp, My Kind of Town and My Way

programme.title: Arena
programme.desc: Profile of the singer and actor, nicknamed Ol' Blue Eyes, best known for such songs as My Way and Strangers in the Night. Featuring interviews with his friends and family that uncover aspects of his rich personal life, which included four marriages, Las Vegas business interests and alleged association with the Mafia

programme.title: High Society (1956)
programme.desc: Romantic complications arise when a playboy composer sets out to win back his ex-wife. However, she is about to marry another man - and the situation becomes even more difficult when a cynical reporter enters the fray. Musical comedy based on The Philadelphia Story with a score by Cole Porter, starring Bing Crosby, Frank Sinatra and Grace Kelly, with Louis Armstrong appearing as himself

programme.title: Talking Pictures
programme.desc: Sylvia Sims narrates a retrospective look at TV appearances made over the years by American actor and singer Bing Crosby, with interviews from the archive and classic clips capturing the milestones and highlights of his life and career

programme.title: Wild Men (2021)
programme.desc: A man suffering from a mid-life crisis relocates his family high into the mountains, so they can live as hunter gatherers like their ancestors did thousands of years ago. Norwegian comedy, starring Rasmus Bjerg, Sofie Grabol and Zaki Youssef. In Norwegian, Danish and English

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo sets off on the first leg of a new quest as he travels around South-east Asia, guided by his 1913 Bradshaw's Handbook on a 2,500-mile railway adventure across six countries. Beginning in Hong Kong, the former politician investigates how Britain won the island and Kowloon from China after two mid-19th century wars over the trade in opium, before boarding the island's most famous funicular to the Peak, and straddling a bamboo pole to learn the traditional Cantonese art of noodle-making

programme.title: Canal Boat Diaries
programme.desc: Narrowboater Robbie Cumming explores the Victorian village of Saltaire on the Leeds and Liverpool Canal. He also moors up in Leeds and goes in search of an abandoned waterway on the Aire and Calder Navigation

programme.title: Jet! When Britain Ruled the Skies
programme.desc: Two-part documentary examining advances in British aviation in the 1950s and 60s, which begins by exploring the design and technology behind a new generation of military planes including the Vulcan bomber and the Meteor jet fighter. The first programme investigates how the achievements came at a time of national austerity, and there is a tragic reminder of how some test pilots paid the ultimate price for their work. Including contributions by Norman Tebbit and Tony Blackman

programme.title: Jesus Christ Superstar (1973)
programme.desc: Musical following the last days in the life of Jesus Christ, seen from the perspective of the disciple Judas, who is gradually tempted into betraying his friend and sending him to his death. Based on the Andrew Lloyd Webber stage show and starring Ted Neeley, Carl Anderson, Yvonne Elliman and Barry Dennan

programme.title: Marti Webb: Tell Me on a Sunday
programme.desc: Filmed concert performance of the one-woman musical show written by Andrew Lloyd Webber and Don Black, starring Marti Webb as an English girl who travels to America in search of love. With the London Philharmonic Orchestra under conductor Harry Rabinowitz

programme.title: A Timewatch Guide
programme.desc: Vanessa Collingridge examines the life of Elizabeth Tudor, with a focus on how documentary TV and the BBC have looked at her legacy and interrogated her reign. Using archive stretching back over 60 years, her upbringing, her conflicts with enemies including Mary Queen of Scots, and her greatest victory against the Spanish Armada are investigated. The programme seeks to understand how the monarch created a legacy that people still live with today, and how it has changed throughout the centuries

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo sets off on the first leg of a new quest as he travels around South-east Asia, guided by his 1913 Bradshaw's Handbook on a 2,500-mile railway adventure across six countries. Beginning in Hong Kong, the former politician investigates how Britain won the island and Kowloon from China after two mid-19th century wars over the trade in opium, before boarding the island's most famous funicular to the Peak, and straddling a bamboo pole to learn the traditional Cantonese art of noodle-making

With contributions from David Attenborough and Joanna Lumley

programme.title: OZT Goes Wild in Britain : Urban
programme.desc: The OZT brothers pack their binoculars to explore the natural world right on our doorstep, meeting some of the surprising urban wild animals that can be found in our towns and cities. Tyler finds himself holding onto a cliff edge in Bristol to find out why the fastest bird on earth, the peregrine falcon, is quickly becoming the top bird in town. Aaron heads to Devon to reveal how the water vole is being brought back from the brink of extinction. He also lends a helping hand at a wildlife rescue centre as they give two hedgehog patients a new home Back at OZT HQ, bird expert Nadeem pits the brothers against each other to find out which of them is the ultimate bird brain. programme.title: OZT Goes Wild in Britain : Wetlands
programme.desc: Cam, Tyler and Aaron explore the wonders of the wetlands and meet the wildlife heroes working hard to help protect its animal inhabitants. It’s an early start for Tyler as he heads to Devon hoping to bump into a beaver and discover why this furry eco engineer is having a huge impact on the land and its wildlife. Cam is on the outskirts of Manchester to lend a hand restoring a wetland habitat that is helping combat climate change, all thanks to a super-plant called sphagnum moss. On the Isle of Mull, the OZT brothers go head-to-head as they look to spot an otter. They find out how this wetland wonder is making a big comeback - but whose animal tracking skills will win the day? programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Celebrity Mastermind
programme.desc: Journalist John Pienaar, lead singer of Britpop band Shed Seven, Rick Witter, comedian Suzi Ruffell, and actor Dakota Blue Richards are in the famous black chair, answering Clive Myrie's questions on Clement Attlee, the Smiths, the films of Sandra Bullock, and the music of Lana Del Rey

programme.title: Celebrity Bridge of Lies
programme.desc: Ross Kemp hosts the game show, which sees radio presenters Tony Blackburn, Katie Thistleton, YolanDa Brown and Lauren Layfield taking it in turns to cross the floor by only stepping on the correct answers - and doing their best to avoid the wrong ones. For the final crossing, those who have been successful join forces for a chance to take home the money for their chosen charities

programme.title: Blankety Blank
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh hosts a revival of the comedy quiz show, in which a panel of six celebrities fill in the missing blanks to help contestants win some brilliant prizes. With Adjoa Andoh, Martine McCutcheon, Johnny Vegas, Jimmy Carr, Chizzy Akudolu and Joe Swash

programme.title: Pointless Celebrities
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman present a star-studded version of the general knowledge quiz. Tomasz Schafernaker, Owain Wyn Evans, Kerry Godliman, Toussaint Douglass, Nicki Chapman, Kelli Young, Jeremy Edwards and Lucy Dixon try to come up with the least likely correct answers to a series of questions posed to members of the public to win a prize for the charity of their choice

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Faith treats a patient who has been pulled from the water after a car crash, but her sense of control is tested when an unexpected arrival forces her to confront her darkest secret. She recalls a time when frustration with her own children drove her to lose control, and seeks to make amends by coming to the aid of her patient's distraught daughter

programme.title: Magpie Murders
programme.desc: Anthony Horowitz's adaptation of his novel, starring Lesley Manville. Editor Susan Ryeland is eagerly awaiting the manuscript from Clover Books' number one best-selling author Alan Conway, whose hero Atticus Pünd regularly solves murder mysteries in the fictional village of Saxby on Avon. Susan is drawn into her own mystery when she and her boss realise that the final chapter is missing and Conway is found dead in his shrubbery. With Conleth Hill and Tim McMullan

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Gary Lineker presents highlights of the latest Premier League fixtures, including Manchester City v Liverpool at Etihad Stadium and Arsenal v Leeds United at Emirates Stadium. The Citizens were looking to avenge a 1-0 defeat at Anfield against an inconsistent Liverpool side, while fellow title-challengers Arsenal will have expected three points against struggling Leeds. Plus, Bournemouth v Fulham, Brighton & Hove Albion v Brentford, Crystal Palace v Leicester City, Nottingham Forest v Wolverhampton Wanderers and Chelsea v Aston Villa

programme.title: Legends of Welsh Sport
programme.desc: A profile of the surfer, who overcame a devastating injury in a car crash to keep his dreams alive and earned respect in his profession around the world

programme.title: Match of the Day Top 10
programme.desc: Gary Lineker, Alan Shearer and Micah Richards count down the best pundits of the Premier League era

programme.title: Anton & Giovanni's Adventures in Sicily
programme.desc: The second leg of their trip takes Anton and Giovanni to Mount Etna, Europe's highest and most active volcano. Along the way Giovanni takes Anton to a traditional Sicilian barber to get beach ready before trying paddleboarding in the Ionian Sea. When they reach the volcano, the pair hike halfway to the summit with some help from some unexpected furry friends before deciding to camp overnight. A surprise visit from 2021 Strictly champion Rose Ayling-Ellis wakes them up and they complete their trek in style by taking to the skies and flying over the crater in a helicopter

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Charlie Stayt and Naga Munchetty present a round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Gethin Jones co-hosts the weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: The Moment of Proof
programme.desc: A jacket recovered from a suspect's home has the DNA of not one, but two, stabbing victims on it as police hunt for the person behind a series of seemingly unprovoked attacks. There's little for detectives to go on after a man is left to die in the street and when the attacker strikes again they are in a race against time to find the person responsible. Plus, a fingerprint found on the number plate of the getaway car used in the armed robbery of a neighbourhood pub leads officers to their suspect

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: The keepers have a challenge on their hands when two-year-old porcupine Spud goes missing. How do you find an escaped animal, amongst a million trees, that's perfectly camouflaged? Elsewhere, the future for one of the legends of the park, Dave the wolf, hangs in the balance. Everything points to an infection, but initial medication doesn't seem to be working. Presented by Ben Fogle and Kate Humble

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Experts Richard Madley and Kate Bliss help two teams competing in Builth Wells, Powys. Presenter Charlie Ross monitors proceedings and also learns about Wales' washing machine industry

programme.title: Scottish First Minister's Questions
programme.desc: Kirsten Campbell introduces Humza Yousaf's inaugural First Minister's Questions from the Scottish Parliament

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Rob and Karen's big night out takes a shocking turn and Scarlett's evening ends in disaster. Jimmi's advice falls on deaf ears. Medical drama series set in a busy Midlands surgery

programme.title: Jay and Dom's Home Fix
programme.desc: Jay Blades constructs a bird bath from old crockery, and the Flog It! team share their tips on buying animal-related antiques

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Margherita Taylor is in Somerset with a couple on their maiden house hunt together. While in the county, she visits a cottage that Samuel Taylor Coleridge once called home.

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Raj Bisram and Charles Hanson arrive in Shrewsbury, where Raj finds out how a 19th-century flax mill changed city skylines around the world and Charles learns about the dramatic escape of Charles II during the English civil war. While shopping in Shropshire is considered successful, the duo's plan to spend the night in the great outdoors proves disastrous

programme.title: Bridge of Lies
programme.desc: Friends Georgina, Ross, Sophie and Warren compete for cash by crossing a bridge of stepping stones across the studio floor. Quiz show, hosted by Ross Kemp

programme.title: Pointless

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones, Ronan Keating and a team of roving reporters present topical stories from around the UK

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: All hell breaks loose in No 45 as Rocky's wife turns up. Sonia invites Reiss to visit Bangkok with her to meet Bex and Lola's fundraiser is a huge success, but things become awkward with her and Emma

programme.title: Dragons' Den
programme.desc: Entrepreneurs pitch their money-making ideas to a panel of self-made millionaires Peter Jones, Deborah Meaden, Touker Suleyman, Sara Davies and Steven Bartlett. A surgeon-turned-inventor thinks he's solved a universal problem for parents, while low strength gin gets tastebuds tingling. A Norwich-based couple pitch their children's storage baskets with a twist, and an entrepreneur is on a mission to eliminate the dreaded sweat patch. Presented by Evan Davis

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Future Food Stars
programme.desc: The acerbic chef resumes his search for the country's most exciting and innovative new food and drink business, hand-picking 12 of the UK's best up-and-coming food and drink entrepreneurs to compete to earn an investment - £150,000 of his own money. He starts by inviting the contenders to Glenapp Castle, where he tasks them with creating banquets celebrating his birth-place - Scotland. Will they thrive under pressure or crumble as members of the Edinburgh Royal Military Tattoo, no less, sit down to feast?

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce chairs the topical debate from Bristol. With minister in the defence department Dr Andrew Murrison MP, Shadow Attorney General Emily Thornberry MP, Liberal Democrats' spokesperson on Housing and Communities Helen Morgan MP, Chief Executive of Oxfam GB Danny Sriskandarajah and editor of the Spectator magazine Fraser Nelson

programme.title: Newscast
programme.desc: BBC journalists including Adam Fleming and Chris Mason host a weekly round-up from Westminster, delivering the usual mix of serious analysis and light-hearted gossip about the biggest stories in politics

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Comedians Stephen Bailey and Asim Chaudhry, reality star Gemma Collins and actress Sally Lindsay join host Rob Brydon and regular captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the offbeat panel show. As usual, the participants set out to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible fibs about themselves in a bid to secure a team victory, through rounds such as Home Truths and Quick-fire Lies

programme.title: Jerk
programme.desc: When Lily announces she's pregnant, Tim is convinced she's lying but goes along with it and proposes. Idris plans a stag do to remember but not everyone agrees with his idea of a good time. Ruth takes matters into her own hands

programme.title: Jerk
programme.desc: Lily's plan to scam the wedding venue is in danger when Tim tries to help. Idris has a crisis about the bookshop becoming a symbol of capitalistic greed

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Charlie Stayt and Naga Munchetty present a round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Gethin Jones co-hosts the weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: The Moment of Proof
programme.desc: Fingerprints found at the scene of a burglary are the missing piece of evidence detectives need to convict a man responsible for the murder of the flat owner. When a man is found beaten to death in his own property, police use footprints found around his body to identify one assailant, before putting together their case against his violent accomplice whom they suspect of the killing. Plus, a pair of crooks who burgled an old man and went on a spending spree with his card are caught by CCTV

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: The keepers face a tough decision regarding beloved wolf Dave, who after 13 years as the park's unabashed troublemaker, is now laid low with a mystery illness. Meanwhile, four new feisty wallabies arrive, needing to be microchiped and wormed before being introduced to the paddock. Presented by Ben Fogle and Kate Humble

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts, Dion Dublin and Martel Maxwell explore a former stables and church in Dover with potential for renovation, and terraced properties in Barnsley and Cockermouth

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Natasha Raskin Sharp visits Worcester, where experts Thomas Forrester and Tim Weeks guide two teams in their search for valuable items before heading to the auction in Staffordshire. Natasha also visits a rare collection of Traveller caravans

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Hope Street
programme.desc: When an ATM machine is stolen, new detective Al crosses a line to save someone he loves. Meanwhile, Finn struggles to cope - and has a difficult conversation with Siobhan. Drama set in the fictional town of Port Devine on the Northern Ireland coast, starring Amara Karan, Niall Wright and Kerri Quinn

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Tim Weeks tackles a Peter Pan gramophone that has seen better days. Upholsterer Sonnaz Nooranvary and carpenter William Kirk mend a child's rocking chair. Presented by Jay Blades

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Ginny Buckley helps a couple and their dogs to make a fresh start in the Cornish countryside. For their £550,000 budget they want a character property with plenty of room inside for their family to stay, plus space outside for their beloved dogs. Ginny's time in Cornwall coincides with the preparations for an annual steam fair extravaganza, where she gets behind the wheel of a magnificent vintage engine

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Charles Hanson and Raj Bisram embark on the final leg of their trip in north Wales. Raj stops off in Colwyn Bay to learn about a missionary with a tragic yet inspiring story, while Charles visits the former site of the Coastal Artillery School in Llandudno. Anticipating a dynamite final auction, both experts endeavour to procure some potential big-hitters to go under the gavel

programme.title: Bridge of Lies
programme.desc: Colleagues Tarlochan, Barry, Robert and Craig compete for cash by crossing a bridge of stepping stones across the studio floor. Quiz show, hosted by Ross Kemp

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with Richard Osman

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Ronan Keating chat to studio guests, while a team of roving reporters present topical stories from around the UK

programme.title: Question of Sport
programme.desc: Former world champion boxer Anthony Crolla, sport broadcaster Eilidh Barbour, Commonwealth gold medal winning netballer Eboni Usoro-Brown and Scottish rugby star Adam Hastings join team captains Ugo Monye and Sam Quek and host Paddy McGuinness on the quiz

programme.title: Beyond Paradise
programme.desc: Panic spreads throughout Shipton Abbott when an arsonist targets three local businesses, scrawling the word PIG at the scene of each fire. Humphrey and the team are baffled until they realise the fires follow an unusual pattern by invoking the Three Little Pigs fable. A reluctant Kelby is called on by an eccentric local to investigate a break-in, but soon realises that this might be the key to solving the arson case. Elsewhere, Martha has some serious thinking to do. Detective drama, starring Kris Marshall, Sally Bretton and Dylan Llewellyn

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Comedian and writer Tom Allen, former Blue Peter presenter Sarah Greene, rugby star Ugo Monye and comedian Morgana Robinson join host Rob Brydon and regular captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the offbeat panel show. As usual, the participants set out to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible fibs about themselves in a bid to secure a team victory, through rounds such as Home Truths and Quick-fire Lies

programme.title: The Cleaner
programme.desc: Crime scene cleanser is called to a theatre, where a male strip show has got out of hand, resulting in a 40-woman brawl. However, a blood-splattered auditorium is the least of his problems when a self-important clown, a whimsical theatre manager, a feckless assistant and a broken fire alarm all combine to create a nightmare day at work. Dark comedy, starring Greg Davies, with Simon Callow

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Pretty Woman (1990)
programme.desc: A ruthless millionaire hires a prostitute while on a business trip. Realising she may be useful in helping him keep up a successful appearance, he pays her to accompany him for a week as he associates with the rich and powerful - but falls in love despite their many differences. Romantic comedy, starring Richard Gere and Julia Roberts, with Ralph Bellamy and Laura San Giacomo

programme.title: A View from the Terrace
programme.desc: Craig G Telfer, Craig Fowler, Shaughan McGuigan, Robert Borthwick and Joel Sked present a sideways look at Scottish football, dissecting the ins and outs of the week's action, with a variety of features covering the full spectrum from the giants to the minnows

programme.title: Nadiya's Everyday Baking
programme.desc: Nadiya Hussain creates some family bakes, from daughter Maryam's ultimate jam and chocolate flapjacks, to an easy oven-baked chilli topped with crunchy tortillas, and an epic cookie pie. programme.desc: Ginny Buckley helps a couple and their dogs to make a fresh start in the Cornish countryside. For their £550,000 budget they want a character property with plenty of room inside for their family to stay, plus space outside for their beloved dogs. Ginny's time in Cornwall coincides with the preparations for an annual steam fair extravaganza, where she gets behind the wheel of a magnificent vintage engine

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Charles Hanson and Raj Bisram embark on the final leg of their trip in north Wales. Raj stops off in Colwyn Bay to learn about a missionary with a tragic yet inspiring story, while Charles visits the former site of the Coastal Artillery School in Llandudno. Anticipating a dynamite final auction, both experts endeavour to procure some potential big-hitters to go under the gavel

programme.title: Bridge of Lies
programme.desc: Colleagues Tarlochan, Barry, Robert and Craig compete for cash by crossing a bridge of stepping stones across the studio floor. Quiz show, hosted by Ross Kemp

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with Richard Osman

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Ronan Keating chat to studio guests, while a team of roving reporters present topical stories from around the UK

programme.title: Farm to Feast: Best Menu Wins
programme.desc: With one semi-finalist already confirmed, Michelin star chef Danni Barry and food critic Joris Minne enjoy a chance to see what's on the menu when the six remaining contestants are faced with freshly grown scallions from the Ards Peninsula and world-famous crab from Kilkeel in Co Down. The task is to turn them into a memorable menu for a mouth-watering meal - and that second place in the semi-final. Presented by Eamonn Holmes

programme.title: Beyond Paradise
programme.desc: Panic spreads throughout Shipton Abbott when an arsonist targets three local businesses, scrawling the word PIG at the scene of each fire. Humphrey and the team are baffled until they realise the fires follow an unusual pattern by invoking the Three Little Pigs fable. A reluctant Kelby is called on by an eccentric local to investigate a break-in, but soon realises that this might be the key to solving the arson case. Elsewhere, Martha has some serious thinking to do. Detective drama, starring Kris Marshall, Sally Bretton and Dylan Llewellyn

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Comedian and writer Tom Allen, former Blue Peter presenter Sarah Greene, rugby star Ugo Monye and comedian Morgana Robinson join host Rob Brydon and regular captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the offbeat panel show. As usual, the participants set out to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible fibs about themselves in a bid to secure a team victory, through rounds such as Home Truths and Quick-fire Lies

programme.title: The Cleaner
programme.desc: Crime scene cleanser is called to a theatre, where a male strip show has got out of hand, resulting in a 40-woman brawl. However, a blood-splattered auditorium is the least of his problems when a self-important clown, a whimsical theatre manager, a feckless assistant and a broken fire alarm all combine to create a nightmare day at work. Dark comedy, starring Greg Davies, with Simon Callow

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Keepin' 'Er Country: On the Road Again
programme.desc: Documentary featuring Irish country music stars as they go out on tour in the wake of the pandemic. Nathan Carter travels to Spain for a week of performances in the sun with hundreds of fans from all over the world, and Philomena Begley heads to Bundoran for a gig to celebrate two milestones, her 80th birthday and her 60th year on the road

programme.title: Question of Sport
programme.desc: Former world champion boxer Anthony Crolla, sport broadcaster Eilidh Barbour, Commonwealth gold medal winning netballer Eboni Usoro-Brown and Scottish rugby star Adam Hastings join team captains Ugo Monye and Sam Quek and host Paddy McGuinness on the quiz

programme.title: Pretty Woman (1990)
programme.desc: A ruthless millionaire hires a prostitute while on a business trip. Realising she may be useful in helping him keep up a successful appearance, he pays her to accompany him for a week as he associates with the rich and powerful - but falls in love despite their many differences. Romantic comedy, starring Richard Gere and Julia Roberts, with Ralph Bellamy and Laura San Giacomo

programme.title: Celebrity Mastermind
programme.desc: EastEnders actor Ricky Groves, comedian Harriet Kemsley, Made in Chelsea star Verity Bowditch and writer Bonnie Greer are in the famous black chair, answering Clive Myrie's questions on James Bond Themes, Sloths, naturalist Sir David Attenborough and American actress and singer Hattie McDaniel

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Live
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt is joined by chefs Jack Croft, Will Murray and Saliha Mahmood Ahmed, plus special guest Greg James. Helen McGinn picks the wines to go with the studio dishes

programme.title: Nadiya's Everyday Baking
programme.desc: Nadiya Hussain creates some family bakes, from daughter Maryam's ultimate jam and chocolate flapjacks, to an easy oven-baked chilli topped with crunchy tortillas, and an epic cookie pie. Nadiya also continues to showcase inspiring bakers from across the UK, this time focusing on Louise Nicholson, whose colourful vegan bakes such as her signature highland cow and unicorn cupcake have taken Edinburgh by storm

programme.title: Football Focus
programme.desc: Alex Scott and guests look ahead to the weekend's fixtures, including Arsenal v Leeds United, plus news from the lunchtime game between Manchester City and Liverpool

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Anita Manning and Christina Trevanion present from the Oswestry Showground, where the teams search for antiques with the help of Kate Bliss and Ochuko Ojiri

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Charlie Dimmock and the Rich brothers meet a couple in Clapham juggling older parents, twin babies and busy careers, while in Shrewsbury, a garden has nothing exciting for children

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Briony May Williams is on her home turf in Somerset as she helps a couple swap their narrow boat for a more traditional house. She also visits a market garden initiative which operates alongside a hostel for the homeless

programme.title: Final Score
programme.desc: A round-up of the results and this afternoon's news from the Premier League, EFL and Scotland

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Celebrity Mastermind
programme.desc: Journalist John Pienaar, lead singer of Britpop band Shed Seven, Rick Witter, comedian Suzi Ruffell, and actor Dakota Blue Richards are in the famous black chair, answering Clive Myrie's questions on Clement Attlee, the Smiths, the films of Sandra Bullock, and the music of Lana Del Rey

programme.title: Celebrity Bridge of Lies
programme.desc: Ross Kemp hosts the game show, which sees radio presenters Tony Blackburn, Katie Thistleton, YolanDa Brown and Lauren Layfield taking it in turns to cross the floor by only stepping on the correct answers - and doing their best to avoid the wrong ones. For the final crossing, those who have been successful join forces for a chance to take home the money for their chosen charities

programme.title: Blankety Blank
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh hosts a revival of the comedy quiz show, in which a panel of six celebrities fill in the missing blanks to help contestants win some brilliant prizes. With Adjoa Andoh, Martine McCutcheon, Johnny Vegas, Jimmy Carr, Chizzy Akudolu and Joe Swash

programme.title: Pointless Celebrities
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman present a star-studded version of the general knowledge quiz. Tomasz Schafernaker, Owain Wyn Evans, Kerry Godliman, Toussaint Douglass, Nicki Chapman, Kelli Young, Jeremy Edwards and Lucy Dixon try to come up with the least likely correct answers to a series of questions posed to members of the public to win a prize for the charity of their choice

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Faith treats a patient who has been pulled from the water after a car crash, but her sense of control is tested when an unexpected arrival forces her to confront her darkest secret. She recalls a time when frustration with her own children drove her to lose control, and seeks to make amends by coming to the aid of her patient's distraught daughter

programme.title: Magpie Murders
programme.desc: Anthony Horowitz's adaptation of his novel, starring Lesley Manville. Editor Susan Ryeland is eagerly awaiting the manuscript from Clover Books' number one best-selling author Alan Conway, whose hero Atticus Pünd regularly solves murder mysteries in the fictional village of Saxby on Avon. Susan is drawn into her own mystery when she and her boss realise that the final chapter is missing and Conway is found dead in his shrubbery. With Conleth Hill and Tim McMullan

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Gary Lineker presents highlights of the latest Premier League fixtures, including Manchester City v Liverpool at Etihad Stadium and Arsenal v Leeds United at Emirates Stadium. The Citizens were looking to avenge a 1-0 defeat at Anfield against an inconsistent Liverpool side, while fellow title-challengers Arsenal will have expected three points against struggling Leeds. Plus, Bournemouth v Fulham, Brighton & Hove Albion v Brentford, Crystal Palace v Leicester City, Nottingham Forest v Wolverhampton Wanderers and Chelsea v Aston Villa

programme.title: Legends of Welsh Sport
programme.desc: A celebration of one of football's most talented players, from his early days as a promising young prospect to his rise to fame with Tottenham and his record-breaking transfer to Real Madrid. This documentary offers and inside look into his life and career

programme.title: Match of the Day Top 10
programme.desc: Gary Lineker, Alan Shearer and Micah Richards count down the best pundits of the Premier League era

programme.title: Anton & Giovanni's Adventures in Sicily
programme.desc: The second leg of their trip takes Anton and Giovanni to Mount Etna, Europe's highest and most active volcano. Along the way Giovanni takes Anton to a traditional Sicilian barber to get beach ready before trying paddleboarding in the Ionian Sea. When they reach the volcano, the pair hike halfway to the summit with some help from some unexpected furry friends before deciding to camp overnight. A surprise visit from 2021 Strictly champion Rose Ayling-Ellis wakes them up and they complete their trek in style by taking to the skies and flying over the crater in a helicopter

programme.desc: Dave needs a new coat and luckily Gran knows of one going spare

programme.title: Clann Na Cruinne
programme.desc: Míriam learnt to surf at six years old and when she’s in the water, her mind goes blank, she feels calm and in a great mood

programme.desc: Contributions from expert Mairi MacRae, gag gangs from Skye, Glasgow and Cumbernauld and features on elements, superhero fire hands and swelling seas

programme.desc: Neen MacKay examines how, over several centuries, salman has featured in the literature and lore of Scotland, from the writing of Neil Gunn to the celebrated Gaelic poetry of Alasdair Mac Mhaighstir Alasdair

programme.desc: Tiree is approximately 12 miles long, five miles wide, and has a population of around 650. Cameras reveal what it is like to live on the most westerly island in the Inner Hebrides

programme.title: Moulin Rouge Ecosse
programme.desc: Following three Scottish girls who perform at The Moulin Rouge, Paris in its 130th year

programme.title: Scotland's Wild Side
programme.desc: Coinneach MacFhraing seeks out unclimbed lines and challenging new routes on the remote and beautiful island of Rona

programme.title: Tuaman Na h-Eiphit/Tombs of Egypt
programme.desc: After three months of excavations and dozens of sarcophagi found, more surprises lie in store for this team of Egyptian scientists. Having given up hope, they at last find a stone sarcophagus that apparently belongs to a vizier who lived during the New Kingdom

programme.title: Fraochy Bay
programme.desc: Love and loss are on the cards for Miss Harper, Fraochy Bay's schoolteacher

programme.title: Murchadh MacPharlain: Bard Mhealaboist
programme.desc: Award-winning documentary profiling Murdo Macfarlane, the Melbost Bard, the renowned Gaelic poet and songwriter from the island of Lewis, whose work was a catalyst for a whole new era of modern Gaelic music. Having composed poems and songs all his life, it was not until the advent of the tape recorder that Murdo, who could neither read nor write music, became known to a wider audience. The programme contains TV and radio archive recordings of Murdo in interviews, and also of him performing his work

programme.title: State of Happiness
programme.desc: Phillips Petroleum introduces a smoking ban on the Ocean Viking rig, while the mayor of Stavanger speculates on whether the Americans might have found oil. Toril Torstensen makes an unavoidable choice. In Norwegian and English

programme.title: Dealbh is Slighe
programme.desc: Calum Maclean heads to Applecross in Wester Ross, travelling from the edge of the sea to the top of hills to catch that special photo

programme.title: Seirm
programme.desc: Mary Ann Kennedy presents the lightning-fast playing of traditional pop band Mec Lir as well as fiddle and banjo music from Allison de Groot and Tatiana Hargreaves. Plus, singer-songwriter Beth Malcolm and new Gaelic songs from Rachel Walker and Aaron Jones

programme.title: Alba Today
programme.desc: BBC Alba joins Radio nan Gàidheal, the BBC's Gaelic language radio service

programme.title: Alba Today
programme.desc: BBC Alba joins Radio nan Gàidheal, the BBC's Gaelic language radio service

programme.title: AH-AH/No-No
programme.desc: MacÌomhair is full of fun today, but AH-AH doesn't think his joking around is very funny

programme.title: Treubh an Tuathanais (Big Barn Farm)
programme.desc: When Muireall goes on an adventure, her friends have no interest in joining her as they are too busy with their own hobbies

programme.title: Pip & Posy
programme.desc: There's nothing on Pip's mind but dinosaurs

programme.title: Oscar & Ealasaid
programme.desc: Mr Martin, owner of the Great Galeries, would like Ernest to play in his shop

programme.title: Piseag & Cuilean/Kit & Pup
programme.desc: The duo delve into the world of clay

programme.title: Sionnach agus Maigheach (Fox & Hare)
programme.desc: A heatwave has struck the forest. Fed up with the high temperatures, Ping Wing decides to pack her bags and go back to her original home, the South Pole

programme.title: Ronia, Nighean a' Mheirlich/Ronja, the Robber's Daughter
programme.desc: There's a lot of bawling and shouting when Mata and Borca fight one another to establish who the ultimate leader is of the one band of robbers
An insight into Mischa Macpherson's life at 12 years old

programme.title: Geamaichean Gorach
programme.desc: Everyone should be careful today as Fearchar is attempting archery

programme.title: Port Pàipeir
programme.desc: Matilda is having fun with Charlie, Bob and Felicia in the forest when her three friends suddenly decide to go, leaving her alone

programme.title: An Là (News)
programme.desc: Local, national and international news and information from BBC Alba

programme.title: Scottish Premiership Football
programme.desc: Hibernian v Motherwell. Delayed coverage of the top-flight fixture from Easter Road. With commentary by Alex O'Henley
