programme.desc: Iona Ballantyne presents the show that gets to the heart of remarkable women and empowering stories in Scottish sport

programme.title: Binneas
programme.desc: Highlights from the Trad Awards 2022, including music by Tom Orr

programme.title: Cidsin Granaidh Chalanais
programme.desc: Gregor takes on a classic fruit cake, but written not long after rationing, grannie's recipe calls for powdered egg. Other recipes include salmon steaks and a carageen pudding

programme.title: Seirm
programme.desc: A diverse range of music with previously unseen performances from some of the artists that have appeared throughout the series. Mary Ann Kennedy presents

programme.title: Tuaman Na h-Eiphit/Tombs of Egypt
programme.desc: After three months of excavations and dozens of sarcophagi found, more surprises lie in store for this team of Egyptian scientists. Having given up hope, they at last find a stone sarcophagus that apparently belongs to a vizier who lived during the New Kingdom

programme.title: Fraochy Bay
programme.desc: Poet-in-residence Torquil Farquhar de Smith tries to capture the essence of Fraochy Bay in verse

programme.title: Scottish Premiership Football

programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. programme.title: Tonight
programme.desc: Seven million on the NHS waiting list means seven million stories of fading health, pain and the fear treatment may come too late. As experts warn of a deadly toll, record numbers have turned to private healthcare - both here and abroad. Emily Morgan meets some of those selling homes, taking loans and fundraising to buy back their health

programme.title: Jason & Clara: In Memory of Maudie
programme.desc: Actor Jason Watkins and his wife Clara Francis tell the emotional story of their daughter Maudie, who died suddenly aged just two and a half in the early hours of New Year's Day 2011. Maudie died of undiagnosed sepsis, a condition where the body's immune system overreacts to an infection, causing it to go into overdrive and attack the body's tissues and organs. Since the tragedy, Jason and Clara have been seeking to raise awareness of sepsis and also to help and give hope to other bereaved parents. Now, as the family are about to move from the flat where Maudie was born and died, they feel the time is right to tell their story and explore their own grief

Tracing the few clues she has, the detective pieces together fragments that point to one person's involvement. At home, Colette rocks the boat with Cara and has to tread carefully to make amends. Drama, starring Paula Malcomson and Abby Fitz

programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: The Fast and the Furious: Tokyo Drift (2006)
programme.desc: An American teenager is sent to live with his father in Tokyo after a brush with the law, but soon becomes involved in illegal street racing. When he ends up owing money to gangsters after losing a race against a driver with Yakuza connections, he has to learn to master the Japanese style of driving to win and pay back his debts. Action adventure, starring Lucas Black, Nathalie Kelley and Bow Wow

programme.title: Shop: Ideal World
programme.desc: A selection of Ideal World repeat shows

programme.title: The Jonathan Ross Show
programme.desc: The host is joined by actor Liam Neeson, actress and Unforgivable host Mel Giedroyc and quick-witted Taskmaster star and stand-up Munya Chawawa. Plus, acclaimed American singer Lady Blackbird performs in the studio

programme.title: Unwind with ITV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Ainsley's Fantastic Flavours
programme.desc: Chef Ainsley Harriott demonstrates recipes featuring nuts, making a breakfast dish of ricotta pancakes with bananas, pecans and maple syrup, while Paul A Young meets a coffee roaster to learn about the complex flavours. Former gymnast Louis Smith uses pine nuts in his prawn and pesto zesty lemon linguine, before Ainsley knocks up chicken satay skewers with pickled cucumber salad

programme.title: Dare Master @Home
programme.desc: A challenge involving baked beans and chopsticks and one in which the competitors have 30 seconds to get 150 steps on a pedometer

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. Lloyd becomes trapped in the web of Petrichor, a very hungry spider - fortunately, Petrichor is also very chatty, and so Lloyd must rely on his wits to try and talk his way out of their web - or, at least, buy some time so he can be rescued...

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. The newsstand has a new comic in stock called Llerd the Fly, and Lloyd is appalled to discover that Llerd is based on him! Intent on preventing any more copies of Llerd being produced, Lloyd sets out to uncover the identity of the comic's mysterious author.

programme.title: Thunderbirds Are Go
programme.desc: International Rescue are dispatched to save one of their own when the Hood traps Lady Penelope and Parker inside an underwater hyper-train loop during a high-stakes robbery. Updated remake of the classic 1960s marionette adventure series, with the voices of Rosamund Pike, Kayvan Novak, Thomas Brodie-Sangster and David Graham

programme.title: LEGO Monkie Kid
programme.desc: Animated series following a young teenager on a mission to save the world. Pigsy accidentally replaces the Monkey Mech game at his restaurant with ping-pong and gets wildly addicted, so Monkie Kid has to break Pigsy out of his addiction using the Monkey King's training blindfold that only comes off when he listens to others. Meanwhile, MK opens a cage filled with fruit babies - when they run amok and cause havoc, Mo has to find a way to stop them.

programme.title: LEGO Monkie Kid
programme.desc: Animated series following a young teenager on a mission to save the world. Speedy Panda stores have appeared everywhere - along with their biker gang delivery boys - and they are messing Monkie Kid's deliveries up and sabotaging Pigsy's restaurant. Things boil over until a food war is declared between them - MK and Pigsy go into hand-to-hand combat in food preparation against the Speedy Panda owners, who just happen to be Jin and Yin...

programme.title: Inspector Gadget
programme.desc: CGI-animated update of the classic children's cartoon from the 1980s. Inspector Gadget becomes a walking bomb after eating a chilli pepper and Penny must keep him from detonating

programme.title: Inspector Gadget
programme.desc: CGI-animated update of the classic children's cartoon from the 1980s. Penny sneaks into a MAD training seminar and Inspector Gadget ends up in an anger management seminar

programme.title: Be Cool, Scooby-Doo!
programme.desc: Monsters and ghouls get in the way of the Scooby gang's adventures as they travel and spend time together in the summer

programme.title: Smarty Pants
programme.desc: Animated comedy series about three kids and their missions from the Great Book of Cooldom. If the friends want to be cool this time, they're going to have to see the latest series of the hip programme River Things, but in order to see it, they'll need to subscribe to NET TV. After a few mishaps, they wind up at Miss Birdwhistle's house... where they all fall asleep in front of the TV. What a bizarre series of events!

programme.title: Smarty Pants
programme.desc: Animated comedy series about three kids and their missions from the Great Book of Cooldom. Our heroes notice that all the coolest dudes are always surrounded by girls, so they decide to go looking for a girl who wants to hang out with them - after encountering several refusals, Simone finally accepts! However, Simone is no pushover, and through her daring and cunning actions, she teaches the boys a lesson about their macho prejudices by hugely exaggerating all the cliches they have about girls.

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: James is joined by former Britain's Got Talent winner Paul Potts, with recipes for clams, wild boar sausages and Korean fish burgers, as well as dishes from chefs Jose Pizarro and Santiago Lastra

programme.title: Ainsley's Fantastic Flavours
programme.desc: Chef Ainsley Harriott enjoys earthy flavours, starting with pomegranate glazed lamb, roasted beetroot and freekeh salad with tahini dressing. Aldo Zilli makes the most of mushrooms in his gnocchi al funghi, and TV presenter Gloria Hunniford goes back to her roots with a one-pot roasted vegetables with halloumi

programme.title: James Martin's French Adventure
programme.desc: The chef's culinary tour of France leads him to the diverse and distinct region of the Camargue, a natural region located south of Arles. James begins at Les Marquises, the Laurent family's farm, where he learns about the Camargue bull, and barbecues local fish for the family. Later, he visits a rice farm and cooks a risotto using his own rice-brewed beer

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: ITV Racing Live
programme.desc: Francesca Cumani and Oli Bell present coverage of the Lincoln Handicap and support races on the opening day of the flat season at Doncaster, plus all-weather coverage from Kempton Park. With analysis from Jason Weaver, reports by Adele Mulrennan and Matt Chapman, and commentary from Mark Johnson

programme.title: Tipping Point: Best Ever Finals
programme.desc: Two more of the most dramatic endgames from the arcade-themed quiz show hosted by Ben Shephard, in which the last contestant standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as celebrity contestants Ruth Davidson, Mark King, Ferne McCann and Dan Walker pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds for charity. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: Celebrity Catchphrase

programme.title: Ant & Dec's Saturday Night Takeaway
programme.desc: Comedian Rob Beckett is the Star Guest Announcer, the hosts give away the very last Places on the Plane and Busted bring chaos to the End of the Show Show. Plus, Undercover features Rylan and a member of the audience gets the chance to win items advertised in the commercial breaks

programme.title: Starstruck
programme.desc: Olly Murs hosts as four more teams of superfans are transformed into their music idols before stepping onto the stage to sing one of their biggest hits. Panellists Adam Lambert, Shania Twain, Beverley Knight and Jason Manford decide their favourite of the night before the voting audience pick just one person to go through to the series final. Plus, a special duet performance by judges Adam and Beverley

programme.title: The Jonathan Ross Show
programme.desc: Singer-songwriter Ed Sheeran chats and performs his new single Eyes Closed, while Jonathan is also joined by singer Michael Bublé, Oscar-winning actor Russell Crowe, and musician-turned-actress Lily Allen.

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Bradley & Barney Walsh: Breaking Dad
programme.desc: The actor and his son conclude their latest trip by heading to Norway, where Barney has arranged to meet a local adventurer, who dares them to sit in icy water before showing them a spectacular stunt by diving from 20 metres head-first into a lake. They then go to Lillehammer home to sample the bobsleigh run used in the 1994 Winter Olympics, before going into the Arctic Circle to try out one of the world's most northerly surfing spots

programme.title: English Football League Highlights
programme.desc: Action from the latest fixtures, including Luton Town v Watford at Kenilworth Road, Norwich City v Sheffield United at Carrow Road and Huddersfield Town v Middlesbrough at John Smith's Stadium in the Championship. Jules Breach presents, with analysis from Jamie Mackie

programme.title: The Secret Life of Our Pets

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies

programme.desc: Animated series following a young teenager on a mission to save the world. Pigsy accidentally replaces the Monkey Mech game at his restaurant with ping-pong and gets wildly addicted, so Monkie Kid has to break Pigsy out of his addiction using the Monkey King's training blindfold that only comes off when he listens to others. Meanwhile, MK opens a cage filled with fruit babies - when they run amok and cause havoc, Mo has to find a way to stop them.

programme.title: LEGO Monkie Kid

Things boil over until a food war is declared between them - MK and Pigsy go into hand-to-hand combat in food preparation against the Speedy Panda owners, who just happen to be Jin and Yin...

After a few mishaps, they wind up at Miss Birdwhistle's house... where they all fall asleep in front of the TV. What a bizarre series of events!

programme.title: Smarty Pants
programme.desc: Animated comedy series about three kids and their missions from the Great Book of Cooldom. Our heroes notice that all the coolest dudes are always surrounded by girls, so they decide to go looking for a girl who wants to hang out with them - after encountering several refusals, Simone finally accepts! However, Simone is no pushover, and through her daring and cunning actions, she teaches the boys a lesson about their macho prejudices by hugely exaggerating all the cliches they have about girls.

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: A Belgian film star arrives in London and summons her friend Poirot to unravel the mysterious threats she has been receiving, which demand the return of a priceless diamond, the Western Star. Rosalind Bennett guest stars

programme.title: Downton Abbey
programme.desc: In the Christmas special from 2012, Robert and his family make their annual summer visit to his Scottish cousins at Duneagle Castle, leaving most of their servants at home. Edith discovers newspaper editor Michael Gregson is also on holiday in the area and may not be there just for the sketching and fishing, while personal servant O'Brien finds a kindred spirit below stairs in the form of her opposite number. Meanwhile, at Downton, Carson faces the task of keeping the staff focused on their work polishing the silverware and cleaning, but with the Granthams hundreds of miles away, minds begin to wander to other things, including the forthcoming Thirsk Country Fair

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A girl takes an overdose and Blaketon's mysterious private life comes to light when his car goes missing and is involved in an accident. Rural police drama, starring Derek Fowlds

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: The doctor and Louisa make plans for their wedding, but the big day runs far from smoothly, as a drunken vicar leaves Martin with a dilemma. Meanwhile, the restaurant where the reception is to be held is flooded and Isobel goes into labour. Comedy drama, starring Martin Clunes and Caroline Catz

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: Since calling off his marriage to Louisa, Martin has begun to question what keeps him in Cornwall and realises that if he is ever to escape, he must conquer the blood phobia that ended his surgical career. Encouraged by aunt Joan's friend Barbara he tackles his fear, but after an accident the pair end up in hospital, where he bumps into his girlfriend from medical school. Later, the return of a familiar face shakes him up even more. Comedy drama, starring Martin Clunes, Stephanie Cole and Lia Williams

programme.title: Blue Murder
programme.desc: An engraved hip flask found beside human remains in a lake leads Janine to a once-successful architect who is now confined to an institution. The ensuing investigation uncovers male rivalries that indicate the man may have good reason to hide his fear behind the pretence of madness. Crime drama, guest starring Jeremy Sheffield, with Caroline Quentin and Ian Kelsey

programme.title: Wycliffe

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Ozias is determined to ruin the factory, despite suffering a personal crisis, and a former cabaret star has her work cut out trying to make up for lost time with the daughter she sacrificed for a glittering career. Beth goes into labour during a day out with the local widows, while Nathan and Joe fight over Alice. Drama, guest starring Maureen Lipman and Sian Reeves, with Brian Capron and Kerrie Taylor

David Jason stars as the irascible detective, with Bruce Alexander, Matt Bardock and Claire Hackett

John Nettles and Jason Hughes play the intrepid policemen, with guest star Simon Callow

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby and Scott investigate the apparent suicide of a solicitor rumoured to have been stealing money from clients. Mystery, starring John Nettles, John Hopkins, Barry Jackson, James Weber Brown and Oliver Ford Davies

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The naked body of a business executive is found dumped in a rival factory's steriliser machine, leaving Barnaby and Scott with a complicated mystery to unravel. Detective drama, starring John Nettles, John Hopkins, Annette Crosbie and Jasper Britton

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The discovery of a priceless music score leads to startling revelations about its composer's life. programme.desc: Comedy arts and crafts show presented by comedian Bec Hill. Bursting with unique makes, top tips and inspirational art ideas, Bec experiments with recycled materials and uses her funny bones to make us laugh along the way. Bec has noticed a mysterious squeaking in the Takeaway so is on a mission to work out what is making the noise. Plus, Bec creates a 'Candy Clock' in the Make of the Day.

programme.title: Dare Master
programme.desc: Game show that sees teenage presenter Danny Murphy take on some of the craziest dares, from rock climbing to racing a hovercraft! In this episode, Danny faces three target challenges, but will he succeed and avoid a gunge-filled forfeit?

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: An endless cacophony of loud noises from next door drives Mr Bean to distraction, filling his mind with thoughts of revenge

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Bean pretends he's been the victim of an accident in the hope of gaining attention, but ends up in hospital

programme.title: The Epic Tales of Captain Underpants
programme.desc: Animated comedy featuring two trouble-making young friends who re-imagine their grumpy headmaster as a superhero looking to fight crime and save their city. During an arts and crafts lesson, George and Harold accidentally turn Melvin's new invention on a dreamcatcher, transporting all the kids to a dream dimension! It's literally the camp of their dreams until Melvin introduces a nightmare: the giant Melviathan from the boys' comic!

programme.title: LEGO Ninjago
programme.desc: The Ninja are accidentally hit and turned into children after interrupting Lord Garmadon from using his Mega-Weapon to turn back the clock

programme.title: 50/50 Heroes
programme.desc: Animated comedy series. Sam is elected Eco-Friendly Officer at school for her Recycling Old Toys programme, but when it comes to recycling the old dolls she adored when she was a tiny tot, Sam has pangs of regret. She thinks that she can repair them with a little bit of effort - to spare them, she therefore asks for the power to give new life to broken and damaged objects. However, instead of 'repairing' the dolls, the half-power endows them with life... and the dolls run away.

programme.title: 50/50 Heroes
programme.desc: Animated comedy series. Sam is thrilled when the students are asked to prepare a presentation on the solar system, but her enthusiasm is dampened when Amber suggests that they do the report together because she's so annoying. To avoid being partners with Amber, Sam tells her that she'd rather work alone, but when a rumour spreads that Amber is planning something totally rad, Sam is overcome with curiosity and pride - she has to find out more about it somehow, but she can't let Amber know.

programme.title: Be Cool, Scooby-Doo!

programme.title: What's New Scooby-Doo?

programme.title: 50/50 Heroes
programme.desc: Animated comedy series. Mo is given endless hours of detention and he's in despair: will he ever have a free Wednesday afternoon again? Amber explains that he can cancel detention hours by doing good deeds for the school. But given his amount of detention, he'll have to perform civic actions that no one has ever managed to complete. To achieve all these tasks, Mo asks the Scepter to grant him ALL super powers.

programme.title: 50/50 Heroes
programme.desc: Animated comedy series. On her last test, Sam got an B+ instead of an A++, which lowers her grade average to a mere A. She loses sleep over this, has nightmares, and even forgets to perform her beloved Hammy's evening ritual - when Sam realises what a dreadful state she's in, her mind is made up to ask the Spectral Sceptre for the power to enter computers to alter her grade average in Mr Brick's computer. At half-power, Sam behaves like a computer virus - and infects her teacher's computer...

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. Lloyd suspects foul play, so he compiles a list of suspects and starts following the clues.

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies

However, Lloyd's not convinced by Julie's promise not to eat them... and he decides to take precautions to ensure that his family don't become dinner!

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: The misadventures of underdog Dave Spud and his family. Dave makes a Gareth-shaped piñata for Gareth's birthday, but his starfish friend is unfamiliar with such an item and confused when the Spuds bash it to pieces. Convinced that Dave does not like her anymore, Gareth leaves and heads back out to sea - can Dave find her in time and persuade her that it was all a silly misunderstanding?

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series

Shaggy Scooby and Alton are good friends (mostly because they will happily eat any experimental scientific food experiment Alton comes up with). Alton Brown is on the trail of his ancestor mad scientist Dr. Cornelius Frankenfooder! It's said he made a crazy Monster from animated foodstuffs that haunts this old castle to this day. Mr. Brown has to get to the bottom of this familial mystery. Obviously our gang is on board to help. Come for the kooky scientific food creations. Stay for the horrible monster! It's definitely a mystery our gang can sink their teeth into…hopefully before the monster sinks its teeth into our gang!

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Bean tries to redecorate the hall, but the landlady's nasty one-eyed cat obstructs him at every turn - until he puts it in the dustbin

programme.desc: Animated comedy featuring two trouble-making young friends who re-imagine their grumpy headmaster as a superhero looking to fight crime and save their city. Now Harold and George must call in Captain Underpants to defeat Slimy Salamangler and help them win the race.

programme.title: 50/50 Heroes
programme.desc: Animated comedy series. Sam is fed up: Mo cannot be relied on, and they're meant to be working as a team for a school presentation. Sam asks the Sceptre for the power to change her brother in a bid to make him behave more responsibly, but the Sceptre goes wonky and interprets Sam's request literally: John-Cedrick is her new half-brother! To make matters worse, the Sceptre is shattered, and as Wanda explains to Sam, you can never ever request a power that works against your own sibling...

programme.title: 50/50 Heroes
programme.desc: Animated comedy series. Selina is rehearsing her speech for a prestigious podiatrist convention - Mo fools around in her pair of prototype orthopaedic cowboy boots, takes them off and leaves the room - when he comes back, the cowboy boots are gone, and there are no witnesses apart from a house plant. Mo invokes the power to communicate with plants and leads an investigation with Sam and the house plant, a ficus that proves to have a fickle personality!

programme.title: 50/50 Heroes
programme.desc: Animated comedy series. Brick wants a volunteer for a 'Nap Experiment' at school, a protocol which he hopes can improve his students' learning capacities. Mo volunteers, along with loads of other kids. Faced with so many volunteers, Brick proposes to choose the candidate via a lucky draw. Mo desperately wants to be chosen. He decides to favour his chances by asking the Scepter for the power of luck. But the half power means that he and Sam alternate between good luck... and bad luck.

programme.title: 50/50 Heroes
programme.desc: Animated comedy series. To retrieve his drone (which he thinks Hammy climbed onto by accident!), Mo requests the power to fly from the Scepter... and yes, he flies! But not the way he wants to: the half power has him drifting through the air like a helium balloon! As he floats above the rooftops on the end of a string held by Lenny, Younes and Owen see what they think is an Alien and launch an operation to capture him...

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. Lloyd's plans with Abacus are ruined when he has to go on a family trip to Caterpillar World, but PB can't wait - she's finally going to find out the gory details of what happens inside a chrysalis! However, the show is not what either of them was expecting...

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. PB has heard that there's a blob of peanut butter on the kitchen counter, but Lloyd's supposed to be maggotsitting and can't leave - faced with the prospect of missing out on the peanut butter, Lloyd therefore concocts a plan to take his maggotsitting duties with him!

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: The misadventures of underdog Dave Spud and his family. Lil Sue asks Dave to 'pet sit' her flea Mr Grumps - when Fuzzypeg, the Spud family dog, eats the little fella, Dave must launch a rescue mission. Will he and the rest of the Spuds reach Mr Grumps before he is dissolved like food inside Fuzzypeg's tummy?

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: The misadventures of underdog Dave Spud and his family. With the help of his friends and a rogue fox, Dave attempts to make amends by shooting a film about all of the great things that Grimsby has to offer.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series

When told of the demonic ghost of an old elevator operator terrorizing the famous store and its clientele Mr. Gunn insists on joining forces with our gang to solve this mystery that leads from the creepy old basement full of hundred-year-old mannequins to a lost floor hidden between two floors of the old building. Can our gang and Tim Gunn survive this crazy elevator ride from the netherworld? Can Mr. Gunn survive how crooked Fred's ascot always is? And more importantly can Tim Gunn solve the greatest mystery of all time: how to find the perfect new style for Shaggy?

programme.title: LEGO Monkie Kid

If the friends want to be cool this time, they're going to have to see the latest series of the hip programme River Things, but in order to see it, they'll need to subscribe to NET TV. After a few mishaps, they wind up at Miss Birdwhistle's house... where they all fall asleep in front of the TV. What a bizarre series of events!

programme.title: Smarty Pants
programme.desc: Animated comedy series about three kids and their missions from the Great Book of Cooldom. Our heroes notice that all the coolest dudes are always surrounded by girls, so they decide to go looking for a girl who wants to hang out with them - after encountering several refusals, Simone finally accepts! However, Simone is no pushover, and through her daring and cunning actions, she teaches the boys a lesson about their macho prejudices by hugely exaggerating all the cliches they have about girls.

programme.title: LEGO Marvel Avengers: Loki in Training
programme.desc: Animated short. When Iron Man and the Avengers launch a mission into the skies of New York City to save Nick Fury and the out-of-control Shield Helicarrier, they find themselves in a carefully laid trap by the cold and calculating Nebula... what's worse is that wherever Nebula is, Thanos can't be far behind! Will Loki continue his evil ways, or will he help his new teammates?

programme.title: What's New Scooby-Doo?
programme.desc: Cartoon capers with the mystery-solving canine and his friends

programme.title: What's New Scooby-Doo?
programme.desc: A cat-like creature is rumoured to be haunting the halls where a dog show is being held, so Scooby takes the gang to investigate

programme.title: 50/50 Heroes
programme.desc: Animated comedy series. Sam doesn't dare confess her futile passion for Booboocat - the cutest cat on the internet - but when she hears that he'll be passing through town, she decides to use the Spectral Sceptre to secretly get her idol into her home. Sam is so obsessed with Booboocat that she forgets about Roger...

programme.title: 50/50 Heroes
programme.desc: Animated comedy series. Brick decides to launch the quest for the golden sock! It's a treasure hunt in the forest. The hunt is mapped out through riddles based on school lessons from that year. The first one to find the sock gets to choose where the next field trip will be! Since he hasn't studied, Mo decides to ask for the power to know everything the Internet knows. But with the half power, the scepter materialises the Internet under the form of a little boy and a little girl...

programme.title: 50/50 Heroes
programme.desc: Animated comedy series. City Hall set up a day for kids to pick up litter in the city. Noomi sees this as her chance to spend a romantic day with Mo. But Mo has one thing only on his mind: the top level in his video game! All he has to do is cross the bridge, fight the last duel and he'll win! But it's hopeless: every time, Mo botches this ultimate challenge. He requests the Scepter to grant him the power to enter his video game and cross the bridge for real!

programme.title: 50/50 Heroes
programme.desc: Animated comedy series. Sam gets jealous when Stella starts spending more time with Janelle because they both love sports, and the invention of a new sport called 'Basket-Boing' threatens to overshadow their friendship. Convinced that she'll impress Stella and win back her attention by scoring baskets, Sam asks for the power of perfect aim - the only problem is that Sam and Mo's aim is off by ten centimetres at half-power! In order to wow Stella on the court, Sam is going to need Mo's help...

programme.title: 50/50 Heroes
programme.desc: Animated comedy series. Mo tells Amber he agrees to help out in her parents' grocery store - he wants the Captain Responsible keyring on offer there. But it's a tedious job, long and repetitive. Mo asks the Scepter for the power to be super-fast! The trouble is - super-fast means super-messy. Worse, he soon discovers he has no control over his speed. He causes terrible damage, which has an unexpected effect on Amber. Mo has to find Sam, fix the grocery store - and fix Amber too!

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. Cornea invites Lloyd and his family to dinner, but they can't stomach Cornea's unique cooking and adopt a series of bizarre ways to try and avoid eating the food without offending their host.

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. Lloyd tries to compete with Berry and prove that he's 'more caring' by rescuing flies whether they want or need rescuing or not - however, his zealousness backfires when he attempts a daring rescue 'outside'!

The local produce at breakfast goes down a storm - but one pair moaning about their mattress makes for a less-than comfortable experience for Karlie come feedback time

Nikki gets the evening off to a rapturous start and regales her guests with green-fingered fables, but Debs is less than impressed by a lack of limelight. Eleven-year-old Chihuahua Gina is a pocket rocket with an attitude problem. programme.title: Princess Alexandra: The Queen's Confidante
programme.desc: Documentary looking back on the friendship between two women whose unique bond survived eight decades, asking what it takes to be a monarch's best friend. The pair struck up their friendship in the 1940s when the then Princess Elizabeth was courted by Prince Philip at Alexandra's home Coppins in Berkshire and she was a bridesmaid at their wedding

programme.title: Zara & Mike: The People's Royals
programme.desc: The Tindalls are on the surface an unlikely pairing of a Wakefield-born rugby union player and the daughter of the Princess Royal born and bred in a royal palace. This programme looks at their life together, from the highs to the lows, revealing how they carved out successful careers for themselves and supported each other along the way

programme.title: Challenge Anneka
programme.desc: Volunteers led by Anneka Rice help Age UK have three days to create a village for people with dementia, building seven shops, a green space, landscaping and an on-site cafe for carers to sit in and relax. The team hits the phones and it's not long before the build gets off to a flying start with tradespeople pouring in from all over the country, but a lack of materials becomes an issue and Anneka is soon knocking on the doors of local firms

programme.title: Britain's Favourite 90s Pop Songs
programme.desc: A selection of the year's most memorable videos, from George Michael and Seal to REM and U2. Chesney Hawkes recalls the experience of filming his chart-topper The One and Only, Kate Pierson of the B-52's reminisces about working with REM on Shiny Happy People, and Nancy Cartwright, the voice of Bart Simpson, discusses meeting Michael Jackson to record Do the Bartman. Plus, Beverley Craven, Candi Staton, Toyah Willcox, Paul Gambaccini, David Grant, Katie Puckrik and Nina Myskow reflect on the year's videos

programme.title: Most Shocking Celebrity Moments
programme.desc: Memorable meltdowns involving famous faces, from Solange Knowles kicking off at her brother-in-law Jay-Z in a lift to Bobby Norris and Gemma Collins' falling out on TOWIE. Also featured is Heather Mills' appearance on GMTV meltdown following her divorce from Paul McCartney, as well as Drew Barrymore's teenage tribulations

programme.title: The LeoVegas Live Casino Show
programme.desc: Interactive gambling

programme.title: Kings of Country Music
programme.desc: A mix of live performances, rarely seen archive material and videos, with classics by Johnny Cash, John Denver, Willie Nelson, Kenny Rogers, Glen Campbell, Elvis Presley, and Lil Nas X featuring Billy Ray Cyrus..Along the way there are fascinating facts and surprising connections, from the Groucho Marx quip that inspired 1980 country smash If I Said You Had a Beautiful Body Would You Hold It Against Me, to the tale of how Kris Kristofferson landed his helicopter on Johnny Cash's lawn to get his attention, and ended up writing him a song

programme.title: Great Artists
programme.desc: Tim Marlow presents the life and work of the Western world's most gifted artists, beginning with Giotto di Bondone, the son of a Tuscan shepherd. Born in 1267, Giotto began his apprenticeship at the age of 12, and with his naturalistic treatment of medieval Christian iconography, was recognised as the first in a line of great painters and architects who contributed to the Italian Renaissance

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: A new girl at school quickly makes best friends with Peppa and Rebecca Rabbit. Molly shows them how good she is at digging

programme.title: Arizona Raiders (1965)
programme.desc: In the aftermath of the American Civil War, two Confederate soldiers are offered a way out of jail. Their former comrades-in-arms are now a gang of bandits terrorising Arizona, and the two prisoners are sent to infiltrate the group and bring them to justice. Western, starring Audie Murphy, Buster Crabbe, Ben Cooper and Gloria Talbott

programme.title: The Wackiest Ship in the Army (1960)
programme.desc: A naval officer is given the command of an old sailing ship to undertake a very important mission - to transport an Australian agent into enemy waters so he can spy on the Japanese. However, he finds the ship is falling apart at the seams and is manned by a crew that does not know how to sail her. Second World War comedy, with Jack Lemmon, Ricky Nelson, John Lund, Chips Rafferty and Tom Tully

programme.title: Run Silent, Run Deep (1958)
programme.desc: A commander aboard a US Navy submarine has a titanic clash of egos with his second in command as the senior officer's obsession with sinking as many enemy vessels as possible, whatever the risk, spirals out of control. Second World War drama, starring Clark Gable, Burt Lancaster, Jack Warden, Brad Dexter and Don Rickles

programme.title: The Banshees of Inisherin Interview Special
programme.desc: The In Bruges team of Colin Farrell, Brendan Gleeson and writer/director Martin McDonagh talk about making their new film together, The Banshees of Inisherin

programme.title: The Man in the White Suit (1951)
programme.desc: A put-upon chemist's invention of an indestructible dirt-proof fibre brings him into conflict with clothing industry moguls who foresee their profits disappearing down the drain - and promptly vow to put a stop to his plans. Satirical Ealing comedy, starring Alec Guinness, Joan Greenwood, Cecil Parker and Michael Gough

programme.title: Sahara (2005)
programme.desc: An explorer stumbles upon evidence that an American Civil War battleship, which was laden with treasure when it sank without trace, has ended up somewhere in the Sahara. However, he is deflected from his mercenary quest to find the hoard by an encounter with a tenacious doctor, whose battle to stop the spread of a deadly disease could be linked to his own mission. Adventure, starring Matthew McConaughey, Penelope Cruz and Steve Zahn

programme.title: The Spy Who Dumped Me (2018)
programme.desc: Two friends are thrust into the middle of an international conspiracy when one of them discovers the ex-boyfriend who broke up with her by text message is really a CIA agent on the run from a team of assassins. The revelation sends them on a death-defying journey across Europe with the fate of the world at stake. Comedy, starring Mila Kunis, Kate McKinnon, Sam Heughan and Gillian Anderson

programme.title: The Death of Dick Long (2019)
programme.desc: Three friends gather for what is supposed to be a band practice, but when one of them is badly hurt while they are messing around, it falls to his gormless mates to help him - with disastrous results. Comedy directed by and starring Daniel Scheinert (co-helmer of Oscar-winner Everything Everywhere All at Once), with Michael Abbott Jnr and Andre Hyland

programme.title: Saint Frances (2019)
programme.desc: Bridget takes the agonising decision to end an unwanted pregnancy before she becomes a nanny in an affluent suburb of Chicago. She is hired by Annie and Maya to take care of their bright and rambunctious six-year-old daughter, Frances, with life-changing results. Comedy drama, starring Kelly O'Sullivan

programme.title: The Admirable Crichton (1957)
programme.desc: Lord Loam is proud of his tendency to treat his staff as equals - to a point - while his manservant Crichton believes people should know their place. However, when the entire household is shipwrecked on a desert island, it is the resourceful butler who rises to the top of the pecking order - to the horror of his supposedly liberal master. Comedy based on JM Barrie's play, starring Kenneth More, Cecil Parker, Diane Cilento and Peter Graves

programme.title: Gideon of Scotland Yard (1958)
programme.desc: Police inspector George Gideon experiences an eventful day's work. He learns one of his detectives has accepted bribes, goes on the trail of a murderous maniac and tracks a woman suspected of robbery. He also helps foil a bank heist and gets off on the wrong foot with an eager young constable. John Ford's drama, starring Jack Hawkins, Dianne Foster, Anna Lee and Anna Massey

programme.title: Carry On Regardless (1961)
programme.desc: A businessman starts up an odd-job agency, but employs seven hopeless handymen incapable of completing any task without causing utter chaos. Matters come to a head when their landlord tries to evict them - forcing the bungling workmen to finally prove their worth. Slapstick comedy, starring Sid James, Charles Hawtrey and Kenneth Williams

programme.title: The Colditz Story (1954)
programme.desc: A medieval castle in Germany is turned into a PoW camp during the Second World War, and used to house the most rebellious Allied prisoners, all of whom have made repeated escape attempts. Although breaking out is supposedly impossible, the determined inmates refuse to be beaten and continue their bid for freedom. Second World War drama, starring John Mills and Eric Portman

programme.title: The Eagle (2011)
programme.desc: A Roman centurion seeks to restore his father's honour by recovering the standard of a legion that disappeared. Accompanied by his British slave, he makes a dangerous journey north of Hadrian's Wall into the Scottish Highlands, territory occupied by hostile tribes. Action adventure, starring Channing Tatum, Jamie Bell, Mark Strong and Donald Sutherland

programme.title: Kingsman: The Secret Service (2015)
programme.desc: A streetwise teenager is taken under the wing of his dead father's old colleague, an agent working for a super-secret spy organisation. Will the youngster turn out to be a chip off the old block by proving useful during a battle against a twisted, hi-tech genius? Action comedy based on a comic book, starring Colin Firth, Taron Egerton and Samuel L Jackson

programme.title: Chopper (2000)
programme.desc: Fact-based Australian drama charting the rise and fall of notorious criminal Mark 'Chopper' Read, based on events described in his best-selling autobiographical books, some of which he wrote while serving a jail sentence for murder. Starring Eric Bana, Simon Lyndon, David Field, Daniel Wyllie and Bill Young

programme.title: Force 10 from Navarone (1978)
programme.desc: Ten commandos risk their lives in Yugoslavia to destroy a bridge vital to the Nazis' success in entering the Balkans. However, tensions rise when it becomes clear there is a traitor in the ranks who is determined to sabotage the mission. Second World War adventure, a belated sequel to 1961 movie The Guns of Navarone, starring Harrison Ford, Robert Shaw, Edward Fox and Barbara Bach

programme.title: Hotel for Dogs (2009)
programme.desc: An orphaned brother and sister face losing their beloved dog when they go into a foster home that does not allow pets. The kids find the ideal hiding place in an abandoned hotel, and set about transforming it into luxury canine accommodation for not just their beloved pet, but every stray in town. Family comedy, starring Emma Roberts, Jake T Austin, Don Cheadle and Lisa Kudrow

programme.title: Rango (2011)
programme.desc: A pet chameleon with an active imagination ends up lost in the desert. He makes his way to a lawless town of animals, where he is mistaken for a deadly gunslinger and made sheriff. He organises the townsfolk into a posse when bandits led by an evil rattlesnake steal their supply of water. Oscar-winning animated comedy, with the voices of Johnny Depp, Isla Fisher and Bill Nighy

programme.title: We Bought a Zoo (2011)
programme.desc: A father-of-two struggling to cope with the death of his wife is in need of a fresh start, so buys a house with a dilapidated zoo on the grounds. With the help of the keepers, he works to restore the attraction to its former glory, while also trying to reconnect with his troubled teenage son. Fact-based comedy drama, starring Matt Damon, Scarlett Johansson and Thomas Haden Church

programme.title: Now You See Me 2 (2016)
programme.desc: A gang of magicians-turned-criminals is reunited for a comeback performance by a ruthless technology magnate, whose actual goal is to force the team into carrying out a seemingly impossible heist on his behalf. The illusionists realise their only hope of avoiding the law is to perform one last unprecedented stunt to expose the businessman's illegal activities. Crime thriller sequel, starring Jesse Eisenberg, Mark Ruffalo, Daniel Radcliffe and Morgan Freeman

programme.title: Alita: Battle Angel (2019)
programme.desc: In the 26th century, dismantled cyborg Alita is repaired by Dr Dyson Ido, a kindly technician with a dark secret. As she falls in love with local youth Hugo, the truth behind her mysterious past is eventually revealed. Director Robert Rodriguez's Sci-fi adventure based on the manga comic, starring Rosa Salazar, Christoph Waltz and Jennifer Connelly

programme.title: The Doorman (2020)
programme.desc: After a mission in Bucharest goes wrong, US Marine Ali Gorski comes back to New York disgraced, traumatised, and unemployed. When her uncle recommends a gig as a door guard, she agrees. However, when a band of criminal mercenaries intend to steal from her brother-in-law's apartment, Ali retaliates. Thriller, starring Ruby Rose and Jean Reno

programme.title: The Prodigy (2019)
programme.desc: A mother worried about her young son's erratic behaviour suspects something supernatural may be affecting him. Director Nicholas McCarthy's psychological horror, starring Taylor Schilling and Peter Mooney

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Tony is more worried than ever about the safety of his family. Meanwhile, Cindy comes up with a new plan to get bank manager Alex on side

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Maxine joins Tony and Diane as they await news on Eric's sentencing. Later, Juliet, Peri and Donna-Marie present James with a proposal

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay visits Sushi Ko, a Japanese restaurant in California that is losing up to $20,000 a month. Gordon finds owner and chef Akira lacking in confidence and self-esteem as the strain of an empty business is beginning to take its toll on his relationship with this family

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The chef travels to Newbury Park in southern California to help Mexican restaurant Mama Rita's. The owner previously ran a successful catering company but has struggled to adapt her skills to meet the demands of a new business - and with a year's worth of food stored in the freezer Gordon realises he has a tough job ahead

programme.title: Married at First Sight Australia
programme.desc: Jesse confronts Adam once again, before Adam finally makes a confession to both Jesse and wife, Janelle, who is left shell shocked

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon and Amy's attempts to celebrate her birthday with an intimate night at home are interrupted by the news that Bernadette has gone into labour. However, it transpires that Howard, Raj and Stuart may have rushed the expectant mother to the hospital too early, with Raj having difficulty keeping the gender of the unborn child a secret

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Phil takes it hard when Luke gives him the 'teenage cold shoulder' - a day he always knew was coming - so he goes in search of a stand-in son. A dilemma presents itself for Jay when Gloria suspects Joe is allergic to Stella, while Mitchell does some freelance legal work for Claire, an experience he finds rather enlightening

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Valentine's Day arrives, which for the Dunphys means their chance to dress up and romance each other as their once-a-year role-play characters Clive and Juliana - although Claire begins to worry that Phil prefers her like this. Meanwhile, Jay's romantic plans hit a snag in the sassy form of Gloria's sister Sonia, who ends up trying to seduce him, and wires are crossed when Mitch and Cam find themselves in a sticky situation with pal Anders

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: When Peralta notices Holt is in a bad mood, he teams up with the captain's husband Kevin to find out what has gone wrong. programme.desc: The chef travels to New Orleans to visit Zeke's, a much-loved restaurant that has seen standards slip since the original owner died. programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The chef travels to Los Angeles to help La Frite, an outdated French restaurant that is failing to make any profits. His first step is to try to reconcile the feuding family members who run the business, and so devises a plan to bring them together by using secret filming

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun: Where Are They Now?

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The probate researchers investigate the case of Evelyn Burgum, who was thought to have emigrated to Canada with her husband George, but may have been living in north London all along. The case of 82-year-old Betty Littlewood proves difficult for the team when it emerges she was an illegitimate child. Plus, details of three more unclaimed estates

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: This week's competition kicks off at Woodleys Farmhouse in Woburn Sands, Buckinghamshire, where the inexperienced owner worries that breakfast will be her downfall

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Eddie and Karen Deighton host their rivals at Finch Cottage in Wilsford cum Lake, Wiltshire. They pride themselves on providing a personal experience, but the lack of TVs in the rooms is a big turn-off for some guests

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third destination is the Bell Inn in Thorpe-le-Soken, Essex, where hospitality manager Ian Hawthorne and his fiancee Karen Hunt are confident they can satisfy their guests. But Frankie is less than pleased by the view from her room and one pair of guests are still in a bad mood over their feedback earlier in the week

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Sisters Georgie Monaghan and Frankie Gallie's Frasers Guest House in Battlesbridge, Essex, is the final stop of the week's competition. Frasers boasts a unique location in an antiques district, but some guests are left questioning whether the mattresses are heirlooms too when they discover a few unappealing stains. After spending the day exploring an antiques yard, Georgie and Frankie treat their guests to milkshakes at their family-run diner. Talk soon turns to payment day, making for a tense end to the evening

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The last day of the competition sees the B&Bers eager to challenge each other about the feedback they've received, as Toni from Woodleys Farmhouse wants to know how she can improve her breakfast service. When one pair accuses another of game playing, things start to get emotional before the winning B&B is announced.

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer are house-hunting around Brighton and Hove, where Phil helps young first-time buyers Charlie and Katy. The pair have lived with Katy's mother in Fiveways, but their budget means they may have to compromise on location in their new home. Meanwhile, Kirstie is hunting for a new flat for Dani, who wants to put down fresh roots after renting for the past 12 months

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer travel to Cowbridge in Wales to help a couple who have a home that, on the surface, looks perfect - it's big, beautiful and in a picturesque location. But a long list of gripes, including a dysfunctional layout, has made Amy long for pastures new. However, having inherited the property from Louis's grandmother, it holds a special place in his heart and he is not ready to give up on it just yet

programme.title: Escape to the Chateau: DIY
programme.desc: Billy, Gwendoline and Michael locate their heating problem, but it means that Billy - who's scared of height - has to repoint the chimney 20 metres up. Clive and Tanith get their hands dirty trying to work out what's stopped the fountain working at their hotel and Michelin-starred restaurant. Meanwhile, the clock's ticking for sisters Marian and Tanya as they try to sort out a winter's worth of problems

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud follows the progress of musician Toby Leeming as he sets out to build a house wrapped around an ancient oak tree in rural Suffolk. The design for Toby's five-building home contains six bedrooms, six bathrooms, a music studio and an annexe - a vast project more like a village than a house. Creating this life changing vision on a £530k budget, and in only eight months, will not be an easy task, especially as they must build up close to an ancient oak without destroying any of the roots

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Liam, 31, is rushed to St George's after collapsing at home after his fourth epileptic seizure of the day, and he experiences another at the hospital, while 89-year-old Mair is brought to A&E with severe chest pain and difficulty breathing and doctors take blood samples to test whether her symptoms are due to pneumonia. Twelve-year-old Lauren arrives by ambulance after breaking her leg while scoring a try in a rugby match and she needs extensive surgery to give her the best chance of walking normally again

programme.title: 999: What's Your Emergency?
programme.desc: The documentary focuses on the demands placed on the women and men who answer people's cries for help. As an ambulance crew answers a call to a heart attack, call handlers guide the victim's daughter through administering CPR. A nine-year-old boy is coached through a terrifying situation when his mother suffers a diabetic emergency while driving, and a father-to-be is instructed how to deliver his baby over the phone

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Seventy-one-year-old Tony is rushed to A&E by air ambulance after falling head first onto a tiled floor while doing DIY in his kitchen. Meanwhile, 23-year-old Charlie's facial injuries are treated after he was assaulted on his way home from a night out. A 10-year-old girl, Lucy, arrives at St George's after having seizures for the past 48 hours

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.desc: Crewmates Rob Moore and Ally Shipway rush to a dramatic car crash. The driver of the car is arrested for drink-driving. Jan Vann and Chelsie Kennedy treat a 93-year-old war veteran who has fallen and may also have a life-threatening infection. Paramedics Peter Bowles and Manoj Summan treat a man who may have had a stroke. They also rush to a four-year-old who is pale and vomiting and needs to be seen by specialists right away

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E

Twelve-year-old Lauren arrives by ambulance after breaking her leg while scoring a try in a rugby match and she needs extensive surgery to give her the best chance of walking normally again

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: The team revisits favourite investigations, including Kate Quilton's visit to the world's largest producer of jelly beans to find out what goes into the sweets. Matt Tebbutt attempts to find out why tinned anchovies taste so salty, and Jimmy Doherty heads to a Mauritius distillery as he explores the secrets of rum

programme.title: Kirstie's Vintage Gems
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp demonstrates how to create handmade and personalised gifts. She learns about sugarcraft and perfume-making, and also receives a lesson in the art of designing Victorian-style silhouettes

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Recently retired GP Steve Kanani and wife Fernanda seeks help to find the perfect holiday home for their family in the Valencia region of Southern Spain. Leaving no stone unturned, Danni Menzies scours the local market and delivers five fantastic properties. With so many great options proves a hard decision for the pair to make

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun: Where Are They Now?
programme.desc: Catching up with the owners of a Spanish riding centre who were struggling to break even. Plus, two glampsite owners in France take drastic action when their business closes

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien travel around Britain to find items to fix up and flog on to make a profit for their owners. In this episode, Henry finds a treat for restorer Guy, and Simon creates stunning table lamps from old theatre lights

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Max McMurdo head to Wales to see how can create the most profit on items, including an oil dispenser, fire grate, chaise longue and even a catamaran

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The probate detectives explore the case of Brett Miller, who died aged just 39, and investigate John Woor's life story, from his time in wartime India to his experiences in the world of art. Plus, details of three more unclaimed estates

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The first visit of the week is to the Grantham Arms in Boroughbridge, North Yorkshire. The guests are dazzled by the décor, and enjoy a day out visiting a mystical cave

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Carl Insley and best friend Sharon are the hosts at Driftwood Luxury Lodges in Dale Abbey in Derbyshire, where they offer a luxury glamping experience. The stylish home-made furniture is a hit, although one camper notices it might not be very practical, and while the continental breakfast is a hit with one couple, others find it hard to swallow

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The hoteliers head to Southport, where husband and wife Rick and Sarah Blaney run the Stamford. However, things do not get off to a great start when Annelies and Claudia are left out in the cold by the self check-in

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Mother-and-daughter team Annelies and Claudia Richardson host the week's last visit at the Fauconberg Arms in Coxwold, North Yorkshire. Their ethos is that food is just as important as the rooms, but this threatens to prove their downfall when Rick and Sarah have reservations about cleanliness

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: On Payment Day, Carl is keen to quiz Simon and Joe over their breakfast woes, while Rick and Sarah want to know why they were scored so badly for their hosting skills. Meanwhile, Annelies and Claudia from the Fauconberg Arms want to wipe the slate with Sarah and Rick's cleanliness critique

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp helps couple Rachael and Mark in Woking search for a new home. The pair are currently renting, but are desperate to put their money into their own home before the arrival of their second child. Meanwhile, Phil heads to Guildford to assist Indu and Jason in their property search. The couple want a project, but with a second child due in a matter of months, they do not want to buy somewhere that would require too much work. When Phil finds them something suitable, it is time to get tough with the agent

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer are in Lincoln to help a couple end the five-year debate over their two-bedroom bungalow. Eric has never been a fan of their home's dysfunctional layout and now they have had a baby, and also have Eric's two teenage boys staying over regularly, there is just not enough room for all five of them. Carly, however, is adamant that she will not move away from her family, who live nearby, and believes an extension will give them the space they need

programme.title: Escape to the Chateau: DIY
programme.desc: Billy, Gwendoline and Michael finally hope to move into their chateau so they can host a hen party, although the kitchen's unfinished. In the Loire Valley, Paul and Karen rent out their chateau as a holiday gite hoping to attract more guests by creating an office in an old water tower. Meanwhile, Dick and Angel try to keep costs down when shopping for baths

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud follows an ambitious build in Cornwall, as Leigh and Richard transform a derelict 17th-century flour mill into a contemporary, three-bedroom home. They employ traditional craftsmen to start work on restoring the exterior, but it's not long before the true scale of the damage to the structure is revealed, and as the costs rise, they are forced to take on more of the work themselves

programme.title: Astrid: Murder in Paris
programme.desc: A famous lawyer is murdered in front of 12 witnesses, but somewhat bizarelly none of them appears to have seen or heard anything. Are they victims of a hoax, or is it possible they're involved in the crime? The return of the detective drama starring Sara Mortensen as a gifted living encyclopaedia of criminal investigations. With Lola Dewaere. In French

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Eleven-year-old Jack is rushed to A&E after being hit by a motorbike while walking to his first day at secondary school. Twenty-four-year-old Jake arrives after being involved in a head-on collision with another car, and 32-year-old Saumeel needs treatment for a bad cut on his hand

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Stephan, 39, is rushed to St George's with internal bleeding from his femoral artery, caused by complications following an angiogram he had the day before, and doctors are concerned his heart could be under potentially fatal strain. Nineteen-year-old Emmanuel Jr arrives in A&E after suffering an acute sickle cell crisis, and his mum Elizabeth talks about the impact the condition has had on the family, while 40-year-old Fernanda is admitted with abdominal pain, but the test results reveal a surprising reason for her discomfort

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: A selection of previous investigations from the programme delving into the secrets behind mass-produced food. Jimmy Doherty heads to Kenya to find out what makes one tea more expensive than another, before meeting a taster for one of the UK's largest tea producers. Matt Tebbutt braves the icy waters of the North Sea to join divers harvesting scallops by hand from the sea bed, and Kate Quilton is in Israel to learn why some limes are much juicier than others

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: A selection of favourite investigations, including Jimmy Doherty heading to southern Italy to find out where the flavour comes from in his Earl Grey tea. Kate Quilton wants to know if it is true that oysters can be eaten all year round, or whether they should be avoided in the summer months, while Matt Tebbutt is in Cornwall to learn what gives clotted cream its distinctive yellow colour

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Jill and Paul Phillips hope to move to a smallholding and lead a self-sufficient life in Brittany, north-west France, so Danni Menzies shows them five properties for their budget of £135,000 hoping to find the right home for them

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Taekwondo-loving house hunters Gill and Mark from south Wales are looking to make a permanent move to the beautiful countryside of the Charente. They are looking for a house with land and outbuildings for Mark's 'toys'. With £110,000 and Ben Hillman on hand to help, will they like any of the five properties he has lined up enough to make it theirs?

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Husband and wife Carol and Steve's three biological children and several foster children have all now left home, and the duo are now ready for a new challenge. With a budget of £170,000, Danni Menzies shows them five potential properties in the Limousin region of France in a bid to help find their dream home

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer go house hunting in Surrey and the Royal Borough of Kingston upon Thames. Phil is with married couple Mike and David, who are returning from Central America and want their first home together, - whilst Kirstie is with science teachers Kat and Pat, who desperately want a place of their own before wedding bells ring for them in a few months

programme.title: Jonathan Ross' Myths and Legends
programme.desc: Jonathan is joined by Neil Gaiman in the Isle of Skye and the Scottish Highlands, who reveals how the Isle is steeped in myths and legends and is a source of inspiration to him. Jonathan visits Dunscaith Castle, home to one of Skye's legendary warrior queens, before travelling across the island to find out about Skye's fairyfolk, reputed to be able to magically bestow musical ability

programme.title: Home Greek Home
programme.desc: As the build finally comes together, Sarah's focus turns to finessing the interiors. Using her design skills to maximise the small space and ensure every inch is used to its best potential, she makes the surprising decision to place an alfresco bath on the roof

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Mother-of-three Virginia Houslin opens the contest in Huddersfield, West Yorkshire, and her hopes for some flirtatious fun are boosted by the arrival of her first guest, wedding singer Richard Wood. However the cheeky host faces a battle to win over the taste buds of her other diners as she tries to stake her claim for the £1,000 prize

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Business development manager Iyesha Atkins hosts the second dinner party in Huddersfield, West Yorkshire, hoping her sophisticated event will win her the £1,000 prize. However, the evening does not go to plan when Virginia finds fault with Iyesha's main course, and the two women fall out following a discussion about religion

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Wedding singer and confident cook Richard Wood hosts the third dinner party in Huddersfield. With steak on the menu, he opts not to listen to his guests' preferences and instead cooks and serves them his own way. However, with the starter a disaster and the rift between mum-of-three Virginia and ladette Iyesha deepening, Richard believes the only solution to save his night is for him to sing

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Tommy Mack hosts the fourth dinner-party challenge from Huddersfield, West Yorkshire, and tries to woo his guests with a Hollywood silent movie-themed evening, which includes a selection of mystery dishes and his very own style of rapping

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Kim Connor hosts the final party in Huddersfield, West Yorkshire, hoping her American diner-themed menu will delight her guests. The food fails to appeal to everyone's tastes, but Kim's after-dinner entertainment seems to revive her flagging chances of success

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third week's location is the Queens at Horton in Shropshire, run by Tracy and Billy Scott. The rivals are wowed by the luxury rooms - until Tracy finds a screw loose, that is

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E

programme.title: Billy Connolly's Great American Trail
programme.desc: The comedian embarks on a journey across the US, following the migratory trail of the Scots through America - starting in New York and finishing in Nashville, Tennessee. The first episode sees Billy open the New York Tartan Day parade in front of a 30,000-strong crowd. He then heads to Plymouth, Massachusetts, where the pilgrims first landed on American soil, followed by a meeting with the Native American tribe who almost had their people and language wiped out

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo tunes into the music of the mills and collieries of Victorian England by joining a brass band in Honley, West Yorkshire, before stopping off in Holmfirth to learn about a tragedy that led to a tourist boom in the town. The presenter then crosses into Derbyshire to pay homage to railway engineer George Stephenson at his resting place in Chesterfield, before concluding his journey at Chatsworth House, which was one of the first stately homes to welcome visitors by rail

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo embarks on the first leg of a journey to Leeds, beginning at London's Euston station. He finds out what happened to the once proud Euston Arch and heads to Camden to see how goods were transported by rail, road and canal. He reflects on the Harrow rail disaster of 1952 and visits a country estate in Tring, Hertfordshire, before alighting at Cheddington in Buckinghamshire, which is close to the scene of 1963's Great Train Robbery

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo embarks on the second leg of his journey from Berwick-upon-Tweed to the Isle of Man, beginning in the Northumberland village of Bardon Mill. He follows in the footsteps of Victorian archaeologists at Hadrian's Wall, discovers how the introduction of ticket machines transformed 19th-century train travel and learns about the impact of railways on the west Cumbrian town of Wigton

programme.desc: Michael Portillo heads to Cumbria, where he visits the Sellafield site that reprocesses fuel from nuclear reactors, drinks a Victorian brew made from the waters of Cockermouth and explores a Japanese-inspired garden created in the 19th century

programme.desc: The next part of Michael Portillo's journey from London to Leeds begins in Northampton, where Victorian methods have been used to make shoes for more than 130 years. programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Exploring a military strong-hold in the Philippines, a facility that spawned an American sporting great, and an English relic that hosted a cinematic sensation

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo experiences first-hand Italy's 'need for speed' in a state-of-the-art Maserati sports car, and discovers how the leaning tower of Pisa was rescued from near collapse. In Carrara, he finds out how the marble used by Michelangelo is still being quarried and is invited to chip away at a contemporary sculpture. Moving on to Bologna, the former politician embarks on a doomed search for spaghetti bolognese before being taught how to prepare a tagliatelle al ragu. Finally, he lets the wind rush through his hair on a high-speed boat trip across Lake Garda

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo embarks on a Greek odyssey from the Athens port of Piraeus, north to the city of Thessaloniki, exploring the Acropolis and sampling moussaka and baklava on the way. He also discovers the parlous state of Greek finances at the time of his 1913 Continental Railway Guide, and learns how an aristocratic English poet became a Greek national hero

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo ventures deep into the Black Forest, where he discovers how Hansel and Gretel helped to unify the German nation. A masterclass in carving cuckoo clocks demonstrates how the nation's reputation for quality and reliability in manufacturing was established. Later, at Goettingen University, the former politician discovers two sides of student life at the turn of the 20th century - the duelling fraternities and the ground-breaking scientists who laid the foundation of Germany's world-class transport technology

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo traces the early 20th-century roots of the Spanish Civil War, which divided his family and sent his father into exile. The former politician discovers a nation fractured at the time by social tensions and regional loyalties, which today offer a rich diversity of cultures to delight the tourist. After arriving in Majorca from Barcelona, Michael spoils himself enjoying spectacular scenic views aboard a 1912 vintage railway and a 1913 tram. He also gets trampled underfoot at the bottom of a Catalan 'people steeple' and learns to make the perfect paella

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Armed with his trusty 1913 Bradshaw's Continental Railway Guide, Michael Portillo ventures east through Romania to the shores of the Black Sea. Along the way he encounters a bloodsucking vampire in Transylvania and brown bears in the Carpathian forest, before visiting a fairytale castle with modern conveniences in Sinaia, striking oil in Ploiesti, tapping into the nation's musical soul in Bucharest and loading cargo from a crane in Constanta. This leg of his journey ends at Constanta, where Michael explores what is now emerging as Europe's largest grain port

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Armed with his 1913 railway guide, Michael Portillo travels from the Swiss Alps to the shores of Lake Geneva. Along the way, he is caught up in a war zone with the Red Cross and rescued from an 'avalanche' by a St Bernard puppy. He takes to the skies in a vintage bi-plane to retrace the epic journey of the pioneering pilot who was first to fly over the Alps, and tries his hand at watchmaking, James Bond style

programme.desc: Crafty con Fletcher helps new inmate Godber settle in by giving him a few lessons on coping with prison life. First episode of the classic comedy, originally broadcast in 1974, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Nurse practitioner Caroline Heaven hosts the final night in Wigan, hoping to end the week by showing her guests a 'proper Lancashire night'.
