programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Robin and Susan Loxton from Suffolk want to seize the day and buy a holiday home near Mijas, in their favourite part of southern Spain. Danni Menzies shows them some serious property contenders that offer amazing value, but whether any of them will prove 'the perfect fit' remains to be seen

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Elaine and Nicos Nicolaou seek to return to their Greek roots by buying a property in Kefalonia, and Jasmine Harman seeks out five properties in the island's southern region that fall within the couple's £60,000 budget

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Kent retirees David and Donna Bradley want to relocate permanently to Menorca, so Laura Hamilton shows them five properties for their £300,000 budget

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer search across two countries for two homes. Kirstie is with serial renters Mike and Poppy. Mike has lived in 18 homes, but Poppy wants to put down roots and they've chosen Cheshire as the right spot for their family. However, living in a high spec rental has given them great expectations for the home they'd love to own. Phil is in north Wales, helping nature-loving Pip, who's in search of a rural retreat, a chocolate-box character cottage with a garden big enough for chickens

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It: Brilliant Builds
programme.desc: Kirstie and Phil look back on two sets of couples who struggled to decide whether to stick to their roots or move on to pastures new. In Wandsworth, south London Rachel and Tim debated over city or country. While they both agreed their 1930s semi was too small for their family of four, how to move forward was their issue. In Lincoln, Carly and Eric had a similar situation with their two-bed bungalow being too small for them and their family and while Eric thought their only choice was to move, Carly was adamant she wouldn't leave her close family support network behind

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud meets retired racehorse breeder John and his wife Helen in Dunstable. The couple met at Newbury races in 2005 and wed two years later, living together in a 17th-century farmhouse until illness struck in 2018. Helen had a catastrophic stroke, severely affecting her mobility and leaving her with aphasia, which affects her ability to communicate. Constrained by the steep stairs, narrow doorways and changes in level of their current home, John resolved to make a big change in their lives with the purchase of a nearby two-acre plot. Following the demolition of an old, dilapidated house on site, a new high-tech accessible pavilion, complete with wildlife garden, will be built in its place for £1.3million

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share their opinions on what they have been watching during the week

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: A special celebrity edition in support of Stand Up to Cancer, with Tom Daley and Dustin Lance Black, Charlotte Church and Luke Evans, and Gordon and Tilly Ramsay joining the regular cast. Programmes appraised include The Watcher, I Can See Your Voice, Love Is Blind, Only Connect, personal stories in Channel 4's Stand Up to Cancer strand, and ITV News coverage on the transition of power in Downing Street to Rishi Sunak

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Greg Davies sets tasks to Frankie Boyle, Ivo Graham, Jenny Eclair, Kiell Smith-Bynoe and Mae Martin compete, the intrepid players hoping to become the 15th Taskmaster champion. In this episode, Jenny dances around a giant golden pineapple in a wedding dress, while Frankie discovers why cats love balls of string so much. Greg's 'Admiral of Admin' Alex Horne helps maintain order amid the chaos

programme.title: 24 Hours in Police Custody
programme.desc: Two-part special following the case of a naked man found stabbed to death in Luton, which leads police to discover this may be one of a series of murders in which men are lured with the promise of sex, so that they can be robbed. DI Dale Mepstead turns her attention to two men who are seen on CCTV accompanying the suspects into a flat. Will either of the women being held in custody reveal their identity?

programme.title: 24 Hours in Police Custody
programme.desc: When a man is found dead and completely naked after bleeding out from a stab wound to his thigh, Bedfordshire's Major Crime unit charge two women who they believe enticed the man into meeting them with the promise of sex, but instead had the intention of robbing him. CCTV reveals the women were accompanied by two men on the night of the murder. Now with four suspects in custody, investigators need to work out who is behind the 'honey trap' plot and which of their suspects is responsible for the murder

programme.title: The Dog Academy
programme.desc: A crack team of Britain's top specialist trainers instructs beleaguered owners in dog management skills and dog psychology. Ferocious cockapoo Bear is driving a wedge between owners Paul and Louise. With their marriage under stress, Victoria and Adam must help tame Bear's aggressive behaviour before it's too late. Eleven-year-old Chihuahua Gina is a pocket rocket with an attitude problem. Because of her penchant for attacking other dogs, mum and son Cindy and Cory have to carry her around in a special zipped-up safety bag. It remains to be seen whether the trainers can teach an old dog new tricks

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The guests rifle through the feedback, from Meg and Yvonne's lavatory let-down to Nyoami's fiddled French toast. Meanwhile, Meg wants to know why her tea tray wasn't everyone's cup of tea. After the hosts have debated their differences, the payments are revealed and the week's winner is announced

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Eco campaigner Hector Christie holds the first dinner party in Devon, hoping his selection of raw food and home-grown produce will win him the £1,000 cash prize. His guests - make-up artist Kirsten Brend, slate salesman Damion Fearnley, theatre nurse Jenny Fox and retired housekeeper Viv Foster - are more interested in the stately home he lives in, so the host reveals an unusual surprise to command their attention

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Make-up artist Kirsten Brend showcases her Danish roots while hosting the second dinner party in Devon, serving a traditional menu to celebrate her heritage and some Eurovision-style entertainment to demonstrate her singing skills

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Slate salesman Damion Fearnley hosts the third dinner party in Devon, hoping to impress his guests with a carefully crafted menu of restaurant quality food. Unfortunately for him, two of the diners seem more intent on taking verbal swipes at each other than bites out of his food

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Theatre nurse Jenny Fox's dinner party in Devon fails to get off to the best start when Damion Fearnley is not impressed by the dishes on offer and Hector Christie takes exception to her choice of main course. Meanwhile, the tension between Viv Foster and Kirsten Brend continues as they show no sign of putting their disagreement behind them

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Retired housekeeper Viv Foster hosts the final night in Devon, and feels in confident mood after years of experience serving the rich and famous. She pulls out all the stops to impress with a butler, silver service and her favourite tried and tested recipes. With tension mounting between Viv and Kirsten for some time though, her plans to put on the perfect evening may yet be sabotaged

programme.title: A Place in the Sun

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

The guests she's hoping to impress are DJ Ryan, joiner and part-time inventor Neil, charity events manager Cailin, and window cleaning manager Paul, on a lively night filled with laughter, music and dancing

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Carpenter Neil hosts the second dinner party in and around Belfast in a bid to win the £1000 prize, presenting good old fashioned, country style cuisine to his guests. With a farmyard full of animals joining in the fun, discussions ranging from disabled chickens to eating stinging nettles and a guest performance from Neil's very own creation, ''head in a jar', it's proves to be a weird and wonderful experience out in the countryside

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Debonair window cleaning business owner and keen golfer Paul has cut a dash already this week in and around Belfast with his sense of style, and now he hopes to impress with his fine food. For Ryan and Neil, most of the fancy fare is uncharted territory, and while Cailin and Claire are impressed with the fine dining, Paul sails close to the wind when he suggests that they might like to be his ladies-in-waiting

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Livewire DJ and events organiser Ryan is the next to host in and around Belfast - and having arranged parties for thousands, is confident he can satisfy four fellow diners. Eccentric joiner Neil anticipates a madcap evening of fun, and with a hipster band playing in the living room, unexpected discoveries in the bedroom and several crises in the kitchen, certainly gets the entertainment he was hoping for

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: On the final night in Belfast, Cailin hosts a Eurovision extravaganza. Her rivals have provided top-notch nosh and entertainment, but she believes that her tried-and-tested dishes from across Europe will land her the top spot

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Lyndsey and Paul from Glasgow are newly engaged and want to kick start the next chapter of their lives together by buying a family holiday home in the area around Oliva in eastern Spain. Ben Hillman leaves no stone unturned to find property contenders for their budget of £50,000

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Ex-RAF officers Simon Stenning and Amanda Butcher have been visiting the Caribbean island of Antigua for several years, and now hope to find the perfect winter home there. Ben Hillman helps the pair, showing them five properties for their £330,000 budget

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin helps husband and wife, George and Lennox Thomas find their ideal holiday home in and around the Spanish area of Marina Almeria to escape their busy London lives. With a budget of £150,000, Jonnie Irwin delivers five property options that cater for both their family and double up as the perfect work retreat

programme.title: George Clarke's Remarkable Renovations
programme.desc: Architect George Clarke George meets first-time renovators Erin and Oliver, who have spent their inheritance on a dilapidated dung-filled barn outside Harrogate, North Yorkshire. The newlyweds' dream is to turn the 200-year-old building into a stunning country home that Erin's late father would be proud of. But to do it, they will need to overcome the infamous Yorkshire elements

programme.title: The Dog Academy
programme.desc: A crack team of Britain's top specialist trainers instructs beleaguered owners in dog management skills and dog psychology. Ferocious cockapoo Bear is driving a wedge between owners Paul and Louise. With their marriage under stress, Victoria and Adam must help tame Bear's aggressive behaviour before it's too late. Eleven-year-old Chihuahua Gina is a pocket rocket with an attitude problem. Because of her penchant for attacking other dogs, mum and son Cindy and Cory have to carry her around in a special zipped-up safety bag. It remains to be seen whether the trainers can teach an old dog new tricks

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: This episode focuses on a day at St George's during the global pandemic. Colin, 79, is rushed to the hospital after collapsing in his garage. Doctors are concerned that he has suffered a stroke, but he has also recently been diagnosed with a brain tumour. Tony is in minor injuries with crippling pain in his fingers. The 88-year-old reflects on his life, his love of dancing and how he believes the pandemic has brought out best in people

programme.title: Night Coppers
programme.desc: Documentary going on the beat with the police officers of Brighton after dark. Officer Jack gets a punch to the face as he tries to arrest a man for assault, while PC Ben, in between stopping drunks relieving themselves on the seafront, wrestles a man with a knife

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share their opinions on what they have been watching during the week, with cameras capturing their instant reactions and the lively discussions that are prompted by the week's biggest and best shows

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share their opinions on what they have been watching during the week

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: A special celebrity edition in support of Stand Up to Cancer, with Tom Daley and Dustin Lance Black, Charlotte Church and Luke Evans, and Gordon and Tilly Ramsay joining the regular cast. Programmes appraised include The Watcher, I Can See Your Voice, Love Is Blind, Only Connect, personal stories in Channel 4's Stand Up to Cancer strand, and ITV News coverage on the transition of power in Downing Street to Rishi Sunak

programme.title: The Great Celebrity Bake Off for Stand Up to Cancer
programme.desc: Matt Lucas and Noel Fielding welcome AJ Odudu, Gemma Collins, Jessica Hynes and Tim Key to the tent for the second of this year's star-studded special editions for the charity campaign. They must make Signature sandwich cakes, a Stand Up To Cancer-themed classic tart for the Technical, and in the showstopper they relive their earliest childhood memories in choux

programme.title: Celebrity Hunted
programme.desc: Comedians James Acaster and Ed Gamble, Strictly dancer Katya Jones, Olympic snowboarder Aimee Fuller, actors Nicola Thorp and Nikesh Patel, mathematician Bobby Seagull, social media star Saffron Barker and TV therapists Nik and Eva Speakman go on the run across mainland UK while an elite team of police and military personnel try to track them down. The hunters being armed with the powers of the state - CCTV and ANPR cameras, drones, dogs, mobile phone tracking and social media publicity campaigns, means the celebrities have to be creative to evade capture. As the competitors escape from Shrewsbury prison and go on the run, the hunters are instantly on their tails, tracking them with CCTV cameras and a helicopter. All in aid of Stand Up To Cancer, James and Ed make a daring move with a six-course tasting menu at a Michelin guide restaurant while Nik and Eva escape on a tandem bike

programme.title: Derry Girls
programme.desc: The start of a new school term gets off to a bad start for Erin when she wakes to find her cousin reading her diary, but there is worse to come when Granda Joe announces a bomb has been found on the bridge. First episode of the comedy set in early-1990s Northern Ireland, starring Saoirse-Monica Jackson

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay travels to the upmarket quarter of Hollywood to help the owner of failing health-food restaurant Sante La Brea. As well as struggling to control his disrespectful staff, the proprietor receives a surprise visit from the police at the height of dinner service

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The chef travels to La Grange, a suburb of Chicago, to help the owners of Cafe 36, an upmarket bistro threatening to destroy the marriage of its owners due to the scale of their financial losses. The head chef's attitude to quality control is driving customers away, and it is up to Gordon Ramsay to turn the business around

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: This week, the competition comes from Leamington Spa, where the first host, recruitment manager Debs, kick-starts the contest with a glam and boujee bash for her guests

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Second to host in Leamington Spa is hair and make-up student Charlie, who is aiming to spice up the night with a 90s girl band dress code, even if his own outfit might be too small

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Third to host in Leamington Spa is recruitment director Barry, who is hoping to elevate pub classics to new heights as he takes his guests on a retro-inspired night down the pub

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The penultimate host in Leamington Spa, Warwickshire, is publican Sis, who dons her hosting hat with a sports-inspired evening in a bid to wow her guests with some home-cooked favourites. Nikki gets the evening off to a rapturous start and regales her guests with green-fingered fables, but Debs is less than impressed by a lack of limelight. Relations are strained as the conversation switches to matters of cosmetic surgery, but the mood is lifted with a kickabout in the garden - with a surprising star player saving the day

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The final host in Leamington Spa is lively administrative assistant Nikki, who's hoping that her musically themed menu will see her singing her way to the £1,000 prize. However, she puts her foot in it right from the start with publican Sis - likening her to a sloth. With tensions already running high with Debs, things take a turn for the awkward over mains when Nikki lets her real feelings out and things get heated around the table. Nikki cannot quite get her crowd going with her entertainment as she performs Man I Feel Like a Woman - even if it does get fellow ally Barry in the dancing mood

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Bev Cameron has multiple sclerosis and finds that a warm climate helps her manage her symptoms. As a response, she has decided to buy a property near the historic harbour town of Paphos, in Cyprus. Enlisting the help of Bev's best friend Shelley, Laura Hamilton delivers five potential homes for her budget of £90,000, in the hopes that one of them will fit the bill

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Reality TV star and choreographer Louie Spence and his husband Leto Fernandez have long-dreamed of owning a holiday home in Spain's Almeria Province - somewhere to spend the winter months and short summer breaks with friends and family. Laura Hamilton is on hand to show them five properties within their £185,000 budget, but will any of them have Louie high-kicking with delight?

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: A Nottinghamshire couple take over a massive property in France, a business executive gives it all up to run an organic farm in the Italian mountains, and a couple from London fall in love with a rundown hotel in Spain

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: In Andalusia, it's launch day at a couple's new hotel. In south west France, two gîte owners from Nottinghamshire are dealt a financial blow and in Italy, an unexpected injury puts a group of organic farmers under strain

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Married couple Steve and Dawn first visited Mijas on the eastern coast of Spain 11 years ago and have wanted to own a holiday home there ever since. They eventually plan to live in Spain, so the pressure is on for Laura Hamilton to show them five alternate properties within their maximum budget of £220,000

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Having fallen in love with Italy on their honeymoon, Bob and Lucretia from Southampton are hoping to buy their perfect holiday home in the stunning Puglia region. With a budget of £100,000, property expert Laura Hamilton sets out to make their dreams a reality by selecting five places from them to choose between

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Married couple Martin and Kate are taking the huge step of buying their first property together overseas - around the Mar Menor in Spain. After a difficult few years they cannot wait to find a holiday bolthole they can enjoy with their two sons Tommy and Charlie for extended breaks. Jean Johansson shows them around five properties in the hope one will be perfect for them and their family with their budget of £90,000

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer go house-hunting to help one family and one pair of first-time buyers navigate the Bristol market. Kirstie's poker-loving couple, Liz and Ben, want to buy in their beloved Clifton where they have been renting. Meanwhile, Phil's searching for Greg and Joanna, who want to find a property in a family-friendly area within walking distance of daughter Oliwia's new school

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud meets retired racehorse breeder John and his wife Helen in Dunstable. The couple met at Newbury races in 2005 and wed two years later, living together in a 17th-century farmhouse until illness struck in 2018. Helen had a catastrophic stroke, severely affecting her mobility and leaving her with aphasia, which affects her ability to communicate. Constrained by the steep stairs, narrow doorways and changes in level of their current home, John resolved to make a big change in their lives with the purchase of a nearby two-acre plot. Following the demolition of an old, dilapidated house on site, a new high-tech accessible pavilion, complete with wildlife garden, will be built in its place for £1.3million

programme.title: 24 Hours in Police Custody
programme.desc: Two-part special following the case of a naked man found stabbed to death in Luton, which leads police to discover this may be one of a series of murders in which men are lured with the promise of sex, so that they can be robbed. DI Dale Mepstead turns her attention to two men who are seen on CCTV accompanying the suspects into a flat. Will either of the women being held in custody reveal their identity?

programme.title: 24 Hours in Police Custody
programme.desc: When a man is found dead and completely naked after bleeding out from a stab wound to his thigh, Bedfordshire's Major Crime unit charge two women who they believe enticed the man into meeting them with the promise of sex, but instead had the intention of robbing him. CCTV reveals the women were accompanied by two men on the night of the murder. Now with four suspects in custody, investigators need to work out who is behind the 'honey trap' plot and which of their suspects is responsible for the murder

programme.desc: The presenter helps more families who are being crushed by their clutter. He begins in Portsmouth, where three generations are squeezed together in a three-bed semi that's bursting at the seams in an extraordinary challenge full of emotion and memories. When Sarah's husband Trevor suddenly passed away, she had to return from Dubai to her old house - in which her daughter Stevie and five-year-old grand-daughter were living. Coping with grief, Sarah was unable to face sorting through a lifetime of belongings, so for a year, the house has been totally packed with clutter from the attic to the outhouses, and it's become the way they live

programme.title: Traffic Cops

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: While targeting cross-border thieves and fraudsters, officers are on the hunt for a car suspected of being used in supermarket thefts in a neighbouring county, while another intelligence-led operation identifies a car that is thought to be linked to drug dealing in North Yorkshire. In Scarborough, number plate recognition cameras identify a suspected stolen car, but when police attempt to pull it over, the car speeds off - and the chase is on. Jamie Theakston presents

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: The team are outnumbered and outmuscled when they stop a coach-load of cage fighters following an anonymous tip off that there may be drugs on board. programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Kev and Steve go on the hunt for suspected heroin dealers, while dog handler Liam attends the scene of a suspected arson attack. Damo deals with a drunk driver, and another man is so inebriated behind the steering wheel that he blows three-and-a-half times over the limit

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Justin Moffitt and Paul Faulkner chase down a gang of suspected car thieves, while it takes seven officers to stop a violent thief who tries to sink his teeth into them. programme.desc: Dr Andy Cordell treats David, a regular patient who has been experiencing problem with his memory, while Dr Amanda Ramshaw meets Mary and her husband, and carer, Patrick, who is struggling to cope with the stress of caring for his wife and also working in a full-time job. Meanwhile, Dr David Jewell learns all about his patient John's problematic hearing

programme.title: Casualty 24/7: Every Second Counts
programme.desc: Emergency nurse practitioner Jo Birkenshaw assesses 78-year-old Paul who has come to casualty after being bitten on the nose by a dog and may need reconstructive surgery. programme.title: A&E After Dark
programme.desc: Security are called to an incident in the Minors waiting room after a violent argument begins between two patients, while 47-year-old factory worker Mark arrives after an industrial accident tore the muscle and skin away from his wedding ring finger. Ian arrives in Resus with a worrying head injury after the 63-year-old fell down a full flight of stairs late at night and Dr Jehad must establish if he has a life-threatening bleed on the brain

programme.title: Ambulance: Code Red

programme.title: 999: Critical Condition
programme.desc: Return of the documentary following the work of medical staff at Stoke's Royal University Hospital, as they strive to save the lives of sick and injured patients. A one-punch attack in the street leaves a man with a potentially devastating head injury, and trauma team leader Richard quickly realises he needs to perform emergency surgery on a bleed inside his brain. programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Logan and Briscoe investigate the murder of a psychiatrist, and their inquiries lead them to suspect the killer is either the victim's former husband, her obstructive father or a patient with multiple personality disorder

programme.desc: Part one of two. Ziva confronts her past when the team is ordered to protect her father, Mossad director Eli David, at a gathering of former heads of NCIS. Drama, guest starring TJ Ramini and Michael Nouri, with Cote de Pablo and Michael Weatherly

programme.desc: Part two of two. The safe house is attacked, leaving Vance in hospital and Eli missing, with his bodyguard Amit Hadar dead. Drama, starring Michael Nouri, Cote de Pablo, Rocky Carroll and Mark Harmon

Guest starring Timothy Busfield (thirtysomething) and James Rebhorn (White Collar)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: A student's body is found dumped in an area frequented by prostitutes, and it soon becomes clear she was deeply involved in the worlds of online gambling and high-stakes poker. Hard-hitting drama, starring Christopher Meloni and Ice-T

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Stabler investigates an assault case involving his former partner's teenage son, who assaulted a female friend during a drug-induced rage. programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: The detectives examine the deaths of two gay men, both of whom were labelled as 'killers' by their murderer. CCH Pounder guest stars, with BD Wong, Dann Florek and Diane Neal

programme.title: UpFront

programme.title: Roswell Conspiracies
programme.desc: The story of allied intelligence agents who've discovered aliens on Earth who are bent on taking over the world. In response, the agents form a top-secret multinational agency, The Global Alliance.

programme.title: Legend of the Dragon
programme.desc: Part one of two. Following the death of the Guardian of the Temple, twins Ang and Ling wait to see which of them will succeed him, and who will join the lord of the darkest, Yin

programme.title: Pocket Dragon Adventures
programme.desc: A group of very small dragons live with a kindly old wizard, they're not big enough to fly but that doesn't stop them having many adventures

programme.title: Extreme Dinosaurs
programme.desc: 65 Million years ago, Dinosaurs disappeared. Now they're Back! T-Bone, Spike, Bullzeye, and Stegz. Four prehistoric dinosaurs, evolved into intelligent beings reawaken in a bizarre new world.

programme.title: Bino & Fino
programme.desc: Bino and Fino befriend a horse named Banta who tells them all about his dream to be in the famous Kano Durba - can they help him out with Zeena's help?

programme.title: Bino & Fino
programme.desc: Bino and Fino fly to a snowy Mount Kilimanjaro.

programme.title: Kong: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Kong, Jason, jungle girl Lua, fun-loving Tann and wise Dr. Jenkins take on power-hungry scientists, ferocious prehistoric creatures and incredible magical beings to protect their unique island home

programme.title: The Most Dangerous Ways to School
programme.desc: Children who take treacherous journeys to school, climbing up mountainous paths, swimming across rivers or fighting their way through icy wastelands

programme.title: Pet Island
programme.desc: The documentary follows Martin and Jennifer as they travel to rural Co Donegal for a five-star luxury break for both them and their dogs. Meanwhile, the budgies compete in the All-Ireland final, and there is the story of how a Great Dane bonded with a three-year-old girl who has epilepsy

programme.title: Wild Britain with Ray Mears
programme.desc: The survival expert explores the South Downs, starting from Beachy Head, and examines some of the 39 species of butterfly recorded as using its chalk downlands as a habitat, including the Adonis blue. He also visits the supposedly haunted yew woodland at Kingley Vale nature reserve in West Sussex and comes across peregrine falcons and badgers

programme.title: Plane Crash Recreated
programme.desc: The events of Febtuary 25, 2009, when Turkish Airlines Flight 1951 went down less than a mile from the runway at Amsterdam Schiphol Airport, breaking into three pieces on impact and killing nine passengers and crew and all three pilots. A faulty radio altimeter was the initial catalyst in a chain of errors that led to the horrific crash. Here, survivors tell their story of escaping from the wreckage of what should have been a normal commute home to Amsterdam

programme.title: William and Mary
programme.desc: Romantic drama, starring Martin Clunes and Julie Graham as lonely hearts looking for love. Undertaker William Shawcross joins a dating agency in the hope of finding his ideal match, and is instantly attracted to put-upon midwife Mary Gilcrest - but she is less than keen to go on a date as she has her hands full with a mother-to-be suffering from a terminal illness. After a lacklustre first meeting, Mary agrees to see William again and a spark ignites between the fledgling couple - only for tragedy to strike when her patient dies, and the undertaker is called in to remove the body, revealing his unappealing occupation in the process. With Dominick Baron, Ricci Mcleod, Cheryl Campbell and Michael Begley

programme.title: Park Row (1952)
programme.desc: An ambitious reporter in 19th-century New York sets up his own newspaper, but his former boss will go to any lengths to rid herself of the competition. Drama, starring Gene Evans, Mary Welch and Bela Kovacs

programme.title: Hobson's Choice (1953)
programme.desc: A cantankerous, overbearing boot-maker spends most of his time drinking while his three daughters push themselves to the limit taking care of his shop and home. A timid employee marries one of the sisters, then sets himself up as a rival for his business. Comedy, starring John Mills and Charles Laughton

programme.title: Shine On Harvey Moon
programme.desc: The harsh winter of 1947 pushes British industry ever closer to the edge, and Rita is forced to close the hairdressing business

programme.title: London Live News
programme.desc: News weather events and the best of the capital's culture. Join us to explore life in London

programme.title: Dear John
programme.desc: The hapless teacher embarks on another foray into the world of romance

programme.title: Big City Life
programme.desc: The lives of three artistic brothers, a drummer, a sculpture and a DJ

programme.title: Hitler's Bodyguard
programme.desc: How Hitler's elite bodyguards thwarted assassination attempts by the minorities persecuted under his regime

programme.title: The Ashram (2018)
programme.desc: A man searching for his missing girlfriend stumbles on a secretive community in the Himalayas led by a guru with strange powers. He discovers that their mountain home may hold the secrets of reincarnation and a portal to another dimension. Fantasy mystery, with Sam Keeley and Melissa Leo

programme.title: The Lovers! (1973)
programme.desc: A bank clerk and a secretary attempt to carry on a relationship - despite being the most mismatched couple imaginable. Romantic comedy, starring Richard Beckinsale and Paula Wilcox

programme.title: Relentless (2020)
programme.desc: An ex-convict must stay out of trouble for one more day to secure his freedom - but must choose between his principles and his future when he comes to the aid of a prostitute under threat from a gang. Action thriller, starring Steven Murphy and Tiffany-Ellen Robinson

programme.title: Mysterious Creatures (2006)
programme.desc: Fact-based drama, starring Timothy Spall and Brenda Blethyn as the parents of a woman with mental health difficulties. When their daughter's hostile behaviour and the authorities' lack of support become too much to handle, the couple decide to commit suicide together, writing a letter to a local newspaper to explain the reasons behind their actions. The cast also includes Rebekah Staton and Judy Flynn

Cult adventure, starring Masoaki Sakai, Toshiyuki Nishida, Shiro Kishibe and Masako Natsume

programme.title: William and Mary
programme.desc: William decides to write a letter to Mary explaining why he didn't reveal he was an undertaker, while she grows tired of match-making mother Molly's never-ending attempts to throw her together with Rick. At the funeral parlour, William becomes attached to an elderly woman expecting to die very shortly and is shocked when not even her sons attend the eventual service. Romantic drama, starring Martin Clunes and Julie Graham

programme.desc: Edward Barbary is left facing financial ruin and the situation only gets worse Scrooge comes calling, demanding his loan be repaid. Amelia is devastated by the loss of Jip, but receives an unexpected visit from Compeyson, who gives her a present and makes a surprising declaration

programme.title: Mistresses
programme.desc: Trudi confronts Richard about the thousands of pounds disappearing from his account every month, determined to uncover the truth. Katie is confused following her kiss with Jack and questions whether she can handle the constant temptation. Hari tries to get his relationship back on track when Siobhan suggests they could have a sexless marriage, while Jessica is struck by an unfamiliar feeling of jealousy. Sharon Small, Sarah Parish, Orla Brady and Shelley Conn star

programme.desc: Staff Nurse Rachel prepares to hand-rear two kittens for the next 12 weeks, hoping that by then an adoptive family will be found. New vet Aisling makes her first house call. An emergency call is made to the cat hospital after cat Jessie is hit by a truck

Korean War drama, with Richard Widmark and Richard Basehart

programme.desc: A doctor tries to have a man who refused to allow his dying daughter to be given a blood transfusion prosecuted for manslaughter. Drama, starring Patrick McGoohan and Michael Craig

programme.title: Sky Pirates (1976)
programme.desc: Two boys are befriended by an ex-pilot and his niece, who teach them how to fly radio-controlled planes. When crooks steal one of the aircraft in an attempt to smuggle a stolen diamond across the Channel, the children embark on an ingenious plan to thwart them using radio controlled Spitfires loaded with darts. Children's adventure, starring Adam Richens and Michael McVey

programme.title: London Districts
programme.desc: Short visual tours narrated by Dewyne Lindsay, this time exploring Canary Wharf and Southbank

programme.title: Cranford
programme.desc: First in a two-part special. The story picks up in August 1844, two years after Miss Matty lost her beloved sister Deborah. Mr Buxton has returned to live quietly in Cranford following the death of his wife, although Miss Matty is concerned about his relationship with his son as neither seem to be coping with their bereavement. The local busybody is also worried about Peggy Bell, who lives in an isolated cottage looking after her inattentive mother and domineering brother, so she hatches a plot to bring these young residents together. However, the surprise arrival of Lady Ludlow's son Lord Septimus leads to a chain of unexpected events concerning the looming railway, and a tragedy at Matty's own house forces her to re-evaluate her opinions on the subject. Judi Dench and Jonathan Pryce star

programme.title: Secrets of London with Mark Monroe
programme.desc: London cabbie Mark Monroe takes you to the hidden and more quirky parts of this amazing city that normally lie undiscovered.

programme.title: Mistresses
programme.desc: Trudi confronts Richard about the thousands of pounds disappearing from his account every month, determined to uncover the truth. Katie is confused following her kiss with Jack and questions whether she can handle the constant temptation. Hari tries to get his relationship back on track when Siobhan suggests they could have a sexless marriage, while Jessica is struck by an unfamiliar feeling of jealousy. Sharon Small, Sarah Parish, Orla Brady and Shelley Conn star

programme.title: All the Right Noises (1971)
programme.desc: A married man and his younger lover keep secrets from each other - he conceals his family, while she hides the fact that she is only 15. Drama, starring Tom Bell and Judy Carne

programme.title: The Lovers! (1973)
programme.desc: A bank clerk and a secretary attempt to carry on a relationship - despite being the most mismatched couple imaginable. Romantic comedy, starring Richard Beckinsale and Paula Wilcox

programme.title: All Star Family Fortunes
programme.desc: Vernon Kay invites cast members from two soap families to play the classic game show in a bid to win up to £30,000 for a charity of their choice. Coronation Street's Bruce Jones (Les Battersby-Brown) teams up with screen wife Wendi Peters (Cilla), Andrew Whyment (lodger Kirk Sutherland), Samia Smith (Kirk's sister Maria) and Jayne Tunnicliffe (family friend Yana Lumb) to play for the Leukaemia Research Fund and the Leeds Upper GI Fund. Meanwhile, Emmerdale star Tony Audenshaw (Bob Hope) brings along his on-screen spouse Deena Payne (Viv), Verity Rushworth (stepdaughter Donna Windsor-Dingle), Alex Carter (son Jamie) and Adele Silva (Kelly Windsor), aiming to win big for the Variety Club of Great Britain and the Five Stars Scanner Appeal
